SYMPTOM_TEXT: Site is swollen, red and warm to the touch. Patient has complain of pain.
CUR_ILL: Small red spot on his cheek at time of visit.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Rash: On 12/26 she developed a red spot near the MMRV injection site, on her proximal, anterior thigh, about 1 x 2 cm, red, slightly raised/bumpy. She also developed scattered red macules and papules on her trunk and extremities. She is not itchy, fussy or febrile; she has no symptoms of URI; she is eating, drinking, and sleeping well.

This spontaneous report was received from a licensed practical nurse refers to a patient of an unknown age and gender. The patient's pertinent medical history and drug reactions or allergies were not reported. The patient's concomitant medication included sterile diluent. On 24-DEC-2018, the patient was vaccinated with an improperly stored dose of PROQUAD injection, therapy type: rHA, lot# R018779 (expiration date: 29-DEC-2019) for prophylaxis (anatomical location, route and dosage details were not reported). The vaccine was reconstituted using properly stored sterile diluent (lot and expiration date were not reported). The vaccine underwent a temperature excursion of 15 degree Fahrenheit (F) to 46 degree F for 44 minutes of time frame. The patient did not experience any adverse effects. The call was because of a "data logger". No previous temperature excursion was reported. No product quality complaint (PQC) was involved.

This spontaneous report was received from a Licensed Practical Nurse, referring to a 4-year-old patient of unknown gender. There was no information reported regarding the patient's medical history, concurrent conditions or concomitant medication. On 21-DEC-2018, the patient was administered an improperly stored dose of PROQUAD (strength, route and dose not provided) lot # R017628 and expiration date 18-DEC-2019, for prophylaxis. The dose was reconstituted with a properly stored sterile water diluent (MERCK) (lot # and expiration date not provided). No adverse effects reported. It was reported that the storage temperature of the vaccines was 6 to 14 Fahrenheit degrees and the time frame was 18 minutes. There was no previous temperature excursion and the call was because of a "data logger". This case is one of two from the same reporter (Information captured in MARRS # 1812USA011839). Sender's Comments: US-009507513-1812USA011839.

Patient presented with redness, swelling, and pain surrounding the injection site. Father reported pain and swelling have decreased however redness has persisted.

48hrs after the vaccine spiked a 103 fever right upper arm broke out in red rash, warm to the touch, sore arm. Took child into clinic on 12/5/18 after arm was not getting any better. Provider states it looks like hives and to give him BENADRYL.  Provider calling it an allergic reaction to the DtaP vaccine. After about 5 doses of BENADRYL the hives started clearing up.

Pt presented 2 days after the immunization, with inflammation, erythema, and pruritic rash localized to area around injection site. Mother reports that rash was hot to the touch and has been itching. Pt's PCP evaluated the reaction and recommended to ice the area as well as using hydrocortisone cream for itchiness. We will follow up via phone call in 3 days. We counseled parent to seek immediate medical attention if symptoms worsen or change in anyway. All questions were answered and parent expressed understanding.
OTHER_MEDS: Ludent Fluoride; ondansetron HCl; PROAIR HFA

SYMPTOM_TEXT: At 4:30 am she stopped breathing and turned blue and went limp. They said she had a febrile seizure. She woke up and was awake at 4am and all of a sudden it happened out of no where.
LAB_DATA: Took her to hospital after calling 911 and all they did was check for the flu with a mouth swab, right after I left the hospital I took her to the doctor and he didnt do anything either. They both told me to just give her TYLENOL and MOTRIN every 4 hours to keep the fever down

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Within 30-36 hours of receiving the MMRV, patient developed painful swelling at bilateral parotid glands, right worse than left. This worsened over the next few days. No fevers. No purulent drainage at Stensen's duct. Given the multiple possible etiologies of parotitis (post-viral, viral, bacterial, MMRV vaccine), I started him on AUGMENTIN for possible bacterial etiology. He plans to f/u in one week.
OTHER_MEDS: Chewable fluoride supplement, was possibly taking TYLENOL or ibuprofen
CUR_ILL: Had viral croup one week prior to onset of parotitis

This spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant and refers to a 37 year old non-pregnant female patient. The patient's concurrent conditions included gastrooesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Concomitant medications included ranitidine. She had none drug reactions or allergies. On an unspecified date, when the patient was a child, she was vaccinated with an unspecified vaccine for measles, mumps, rubella and varicella. On 21-DEC-2018, the patient was performed the titers count laboratory test for measles, mumps, rubella and varicella all with negative results (values not provided) (measles antibody negative, antibody test negative, rubella antibody negative, and mumps antibody test negative). It was specified that the patient sought medical attention and received treatment for the events. On 03-JAN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with PROQUAD 0.5 mL (lot # R006213, expiration date: 28-AUG-2019), administered subcutaneously in the right arm, once for prophylaxis (product administered to patient of inappropriate age, off label use). The vaccine was diluted with a sterile diluent (lot # and expiration date were not reported). The outcome measles antibody negative, antibody test negative, rubella antibody negative, and mumps antibody test negative was reported as not resolved. The causality between the events and PROQUAD was not reported.
SYMPTOM5: Product administered to patient of inappropriate age

This spontaneous report was received from a physician referring to a 1 year old patient of unknown gender. The patient's historical condition, concomitant medications and drug reactions or allergies were not reported. On 10-JAN-2019, the  patient was inadvertently administered a dose of PROQUAD, subcutaneous, lot # R011802 and expiration date 21-OCT-2019 (dosage schedule, and anatomical location were not reported) instead of an intended dose of M-M-R II (wrong vaccine administered), which was administered concomitantly with a dose of VARIVAX subcutaneous, lot # R009411 and expiration date 29-MAR-2019 (dosage schedule, and anatomical location were not reported). Both PROQUAD, and VARIVAX doses were reconstituted with the same lot of sterile diluent lot R001088, expiration date 16-SEP-2020 (dosage schedule, and anatomical location were not reported). The physician reported the error occurred because the nurse mistook PROQUAD for M-M-R II, because the vials are similar in color (product appearance confusion) and she did not notice that the PROQUAD label said "varicella" in addition to "measles/mumps/rubella (product label confusion)." No adverse effect reported.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Initial information received on 09-Jan-2019 regarding an unsolicited valid non-serious case received from a nurse. This case involves a 15 months old female patient who received vaccine FLUZONE QUADRIVALENT. The patients past medical history and family history were not provided. Concomitant medications included PEDIARIX, PREVNAR, HEPATITIS A and MMRV. On 08-Jan-2019, the patient received a 0.5ml dose of suspect INFLUENZA QUADRIVAL A-B VACCINE lot UJ035AB, expiry date 30-Jun-2019 via intramuscular route in the right thigh. It was an actual medication error due to overdose. It was reported that FLUZONE QUADRIVALENT, 0.5 ml was given to 15m old patient. The patient did not experience any adverse reaction after the injection. This suspected adverse reaction report is submitted and classified as a medication error solely and exclusively to ensure the marketing authorization holders compliance with the requirements set out in Directive 2001/83/EC and Module VI of the Good Pharmacovigilance Practices. The classification as a medical error is in no way intended, nor should it be interpreted or construed as an allegation or claim made by the marketing authorization holder that any third party has contributed to or is to be held liable for the occurrence of this medication error. List of documents held by sender- none.
VAX_NAME: MEASLES + MUMPS + RUBELLA + VARICELLA (NO BRAND NAME)

This spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. No information was provided regarding the patient's medical history, concurrent conditions, drug reactions or allergies and concomitant medication. On 26-NOV-2018, the patient was administered an improperly stored dose of PROQUAD rHA lot number R017802 with expiration date of 19-DEC-2019 and lot number R020815 with expiration date of 16-JAN-2020 and VARIVAX lot number R019237 with expiration date of 04-JUL-2020, lot number R022116 with expiration date of 02-AUG-2020 and lot number N023963 with expiration date of 01-SEP-2019, subcutaneously for prophylaxis (dose, anatomical location, lot number and expiration date were not reported). No adverse effects were reported. The vaccines were exposed to a temperature excursions of 6°F to 14°F for 30 Minutes and 15°F to 46°F for 1 hour and 20 minutes while the sterile water diluent did not undergo a temperature excursion. Previous temperature excursions were reported as follows: VARIVAX: Lot number R019237: 6°F to 14°F 30 min, 15°F to 46°F 12 hours 45 minutes. Lot number R022116: 15°F to 46°F 6 hours 45 minutes. Lot number N023963: 15°F to 46°F 7 hours 45 minutes. PROQUAD: Lot number R020815: 15°F to 46°F 7 hours 45 minutes. Lot number R017802: 15°F to 46°F 9 hours 45 minutes. A "data logger" was involved. This is one of two reports received from the same reporter. Sender's Comments: US-009507513-1901USA006165.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report was received from a physician via company representative, referring to a 1 year old male patient. The patient's historical drugs, medical history, concomitant therapies and concurrent conditions were unknown by the reporter. On 15-DEC-2018, the patient was vaccinated with PROQUAD lot# R013126, expiration date 04-NOV-2019, for prophylaxis (strength, dose, route and frequency were not reported) and with VAQTA lot# R006210, expiration date 22-APR-2019, for prophylaxis (strength, dose, route and frequency were not reported). On 05-JAN-2019 to 07-JAN-2019, the patient was admitted for unspecified reasons (adverse event). On an unknown date in January 2019, the patient was diagnosed with Henoch-Schonlein Purpura (HSP) at the hospital. The patient sought medical attention but was unknown if the patient received treatment or if diagnostic laboratories were performed. At the time of reporting, the outcome of henoch-schonlein purpura was recovering. The outcome of adverse event was recovered on an unknown date in January 2019  (reported as the patient is fine now). The causality assessment was not provided.

This spontaneous report, was received from a consumer, concerning his son, a currently 5 year old male patient. The patient's pertinent medical history was not provided. The patient's concurrent conditions included asthma, allergy to latex, peanuts, gluten, sugar, red dye and dairy. The patient did not have any concomitant medication to report. On 20-MAR-2014, the patient was vaccinated with M-M-R II as routine vaccination, lot #J000154 and expiration date 09-JAN-2015 (strength, dose, frequency, anatomical location and route of administration were not reported). On 14-AUG-2014 the patient was vaccinated VARIVAX as routine vaccination, lot #J013905 and expiration date 30-OCT-2015 (strength, dose, frequency, anatomical location and route of administration were not reported). On 22-MAR-2018, the patient was vaccinated with PROQUAD as routine vaccination, lot #N028443 and expiration date 09-APR-2019. (strength, dose, frequency, anatomical location and route of administration were not reported). On an unknown date, reported as "after the administration of all three vaccinations", the patient was diagnosed with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), autism and oppositional defiant disorder. The reporter stated that the patient showed aggressive behavior. It was also informed that on four different unspecified dates, the patient had been hospitalized due to asthma attacks. At the time of reporting, the patient had not recovered from ADHD, autism, oppositional defiant disorder and asthma attacks. The patient did not received any treatment for the adverse events. The patient had been evaluated by several psychologists and was referred to 10 hours of occupational therapy a week. The causal relationship between the vaccination with M-M-R II, vaccinated VARIVAX, PROQUAD and the events was not provided by the reporter. Upon internal review, autism was determined to be a medically significant adverse event.
CUR_ILL: Asthma; Food allergy; Gluten sensitivity; Latex allergy; Milk allergy; Peanut allergy

Rash started 3 days after receiving MMRV and Hep A vaccine, also after starting new antibiotics for bilateral otitis media. Rash started on the trunk and spread to her extremities and face. Rash clustered around the vaccine site on her thigh. Parents gave her BENADRYL and hydrocortisone cream.

After receiving the MMR, Varicella, and Pneumococcal vaccines all on the same day (1/11/19), patient ran a fever all day on 1/20/19. However, she was still active and showed no other symptoms. We treated her fever throughout the day by alternating between ibuprofen and TYLENOL. By 11:15pm, patient's temperature had reached 103, and she had a febrile seizure. Her body went stiff and her eyes rolled to the side. She stayed this way for several seconds before coming out of it, and then she vomited. 911 was called. Patient was taken to the ER that night and then seen by a doctor at her pediatrician's office the next day, and this doctor confirmed that all of this was a side effect of the MMR, which was not explained to us prior to the administration of the vaccine. Now that she has had this febrile seizure, patient is at increased risk for future seizures and epilepsy.

The doctor gave her all the shots at once after I specifically asked him not to because my son and I have had adverse reactions, he went and did them all anyways in "combined vaccinations" and she ended up in the ER the next day with a rash(chicken pox, measles, who knows??) Symptoms started as an abnormally high fever after the vaccines. Fever got higher and would not break under 102 degrees. This went on for four days before he went back and was diagnosed with an ear infection and put on antibiotics. Started antibiotics, symptoms got worse and fever got higher. Fever was 105.2 degrees when he had the first febrile seizure, which was followed by two more and then categorized as complex febrile seizures. We was taken to ED via ambulance. There he was admitted. August 26, 2018, he was diagnosed with Kawasaki Disease with a 2.6mm dilation in his right coronary artery. IVIG was given, symptoms reversed. November 19, 2018, his dilation was closed and he has been considered Kawasaki free.

Patient received the injection, grabbed his chest, states it hurt, and put his head down on the desk next to him. This RN went to get a provider and a MA heard me and grabbed MD. Dr. had the patient lie down and elevate feet. She listened to his heart rate, gave a gentle sternal rub and patient's eye fluttered and became aware of his surroundings. VSS, BG 105. EMS called. EMS arrived. Mom declined having patient transported to the hospital. Patient sat up leaning against the wall. VSS. Patient stood and sat in the chair and was doing well.  mmunization list printed and handed to mom. This RN walked patient and mom out.

This spontaneous report was received from a veterinarian and refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. The patient's medical history, concurrent conditions and concomitant drugs were not reported. On 31-JAN-2019, the patient was inadvertently vaccinated with dose of PROQUAD (exact dose, route and site of administration, lot# and expiration date were not reported) instead of M-M-R II, concomitantly with a dose of VARIVAX (exact dose, route, site of administration, lot# and expiration date were not reported) for prophylaxis. Concomitant therapies included sterile diluent. No adverse effects were reported.

There was no adverse event with this patient. However, on this day, other nurse's were completing inventory and were in the room where the freezer is located, making it congested. When the vaccine was replaced (post inventory), the two vaccines on this shelf were switched from their normal location. I reached in to grab the varicella from its normal location and instead grabbed the MMRV and gave it to the patient. I did call the parent to make her aware of the fact that her child had received both the MMR and the MMRV on this day. During the call, I made her aware of the need to watch her for increased temperature and reminded her of the possibility of the rash in that 5-12 day period. The mother voiced an understanding and thanked me for the phone call. The vaccine was also re-positioned on this day to its normal location in the freezer. To our knowledge, no physician visit was required.
Low grade fever for past 3 days, irritable, not taking in much fluids.
Arm red, swollen and hot to touch. Temp 102.

2-5-2019 @ 4:00pm Low grade fever, a couple small spots by mouth in late evening. 2-6-2019 @ 6:00am Low grade fever, small red spots/rash all over face and upper chest area. Scheduled same day doctor appointment for 8:30am. 2-6-2019 @ 9:00am Rash and symptoms identified as viral infection. 2-6-2019 @ 8:00pm Rash spread from face and trunk to arms and legs. Called pediatrician on call due to symptoms escalating and resembling measles rash. Doctor confirmed diagnosis as reaction to MMRV vaccine on 1-25-2019. 2-7-2019 @ 4:00am Measles rash advanced to complete body coverage. Spots had increased in size drastically. Patient was extremely uncomfortable. Took to emergency room; where diagnosis was confirmed as a vaccine reaction to MMRV. Patient was discharged at approximately 7:00am with no treatment plan (rest, time and TYLENOL as needed).
LAB_DATA: 2-7-2019 @ approximately 6:00am blood was drawn. Platelet count was slightly low.
ALLERGIES: Food allergies to dairy and eggs

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report was received from a nurse referring to herself. The patient's pertinent medical history, concurrent conditions and concomitant medications were not reported. On an unknown date, the patient stated that she got PROQUAD (dose, lot# and expiry date were not reported) into her mouth while she was drawing the product up into a syringe (accidental exposure to product, exposure via mucosa and occupational exposure to product). She stated that she had discarded the syringe and did not use it for any patients. No adverse symptoms reported.
Patient fainted after administration of the HPV vaccine.

This spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse and refers to a 15 months old female patient. The patient had no pertinent medical history, concomitant medications and drug reactions or allergies was provided. On 17-JAN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with improperly stored doses of LIQUID PEDVAXHIB third dose, intramuscularly in the right vastus lateralis lot number R013572 and PROQUAD first dose, subcutaneously in the right vastus lateralis, lot number R018778. Other suspect therapies included INFANRIX fourth dose, intramuscularly, in the left vastus lateralis, lot number CX59C, HAVRIX first dose, intramuscularly, in the left vastus lateralis, lot number 3KT7B and PREVNAR 13 fourth dose, intramuscularly, in the left vastus lateralis, lot number W33490 all of them for prophylaxis (expiration date was not provided). No adverse events reactions thus no treatment was prescribed. Data logger was involved.  The vaccine was exposed to a temperature excursion in the refrigerator below 2°C. The reporter stated that the refrigerator had been checked and the temperature was stable. The reporter spoke with a company representative and the vaccine was considered viable as it was not exposed for a too long period that affect the vaccine adversely. This is one of several reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1902USA002414: US-009507513-1901USA011370: US-009507513-1902USA002413:
Whole body Rash, fever, cough and weakness.

Both vaccines were reconstituted with sterile diluent, lot# R006344, expiration date: 13-DEC-2020. No adverse effects were reported.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: While being trained, someone grabbed the wrong vaccine to prepare for a patient. I noticed they grabbed the wrong thing because I work in immunizations frequently and know where everything is by placement. The trainee, didn't realize they grabbed the wrong thing and still didn't notice after I informed them. I brought the box in closer to them to show them the fine print of where one says Varicella and the other does not. I never thought it was an issue until they made me realize how easily the two can be confused, even through they are on different shelves.

16 year old patient received MMRV instead of MMR and Varicella vaccines. MMRV is only approved for 12mon-12yrs according to FDA and CDC. 13 and over should received MMR and Varicella individual vaccines.
SYMPTOM1: Product administered to patient of inappropriate age

SYMPTOM_TEXT: None.

Around 2/1/19 child became ill, was seen on 2/5/19, had fever x 2 days and fever broke on 2/5/19, on that day rash started all over body which got worse for several days, and finally started improving, today 2/8/19 rash almost all gone. On 2/5 Dx was viral exanthem vs vaccine reaction. Father noted on 2/6/19 child becoming more clumsy, had been walking since 10 MOS old, but now loss of balance "almost like he was drunk" and fell often, he is choosing to crawl like he did 3 MOS ago. Previously he would be grabbing a ball and running with it. Dad describes a lack of eye contact. No fevers since 2/5/19, but today in daycare teachers say he won't play, just sits there. Dad describes him as "zoning out" not engaging and laughing like he used to. He was self-feeding with a spoon, now he won't really eat. He is mostly being carried, not engaged with parents the way he was. He use to point at everything and say this, now he neither points nor says anything at all. He mostly screams and "zones in and out". No treatment or tests have been done.

13 mo M with possible seizure (staring, unresponsiveness, and head and L hand shaking every 30 seconds, currently undergoing  further evaluation) 2 days after receiving vaccines, had fever and URI sx concurrently but no known fever at the time of the possible seizure. Episode lasted approximately 15 minutes and resolved spontaneously. Patient taken to ED after episode.

Immediately after vaccination patient climbed off the exam table, laid herself down on the floor and then had 2-3 seconds of the left side of her body jerking-including her head tilting to the left side. Her eyes rolled back at onset and her lips appeared blue and she appeared unresponsive during the short episode. When the jerking stopped she immediately became responsive and alert and color returned.
LAB_DATA: Vitals were immediately checked and found to be normal. She was observed 15 minutes after which her vitals were checked again and a physical exam including neurological exam were performed and found to be within normal limits. She was discharged home.

Patient was administered vaccine on right arm on 2-5-19. The following day, Mom called the office stating swollen and red arm. Patient was told to come in, and was seen by Dr. Dr. prescribed ATARAX and prednisone.
Patient had MMRV on 1/31/19 then developed viral exanthem on 2/10/19.

Disseminated varicella diagnosed about 30 days after first MMR-V vaccine. Child presented with non-pruritic vesiculo-papular rash on sacrum which spread to left lower leg, trunk and left neck associated with low-grade fever. Lesion was unroofed and PCR positive for varicella. He was treated with parenteral acyclovir for 3 days and clinically improved. He was discharged home with oral valacyclovir to complete at 10 day course.
LAB_DATA: Normal liver function tests. Vesicular fluid PCR positive for Varicella (2/12/19)

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient presented to the clinic for a nurse visit to recieve immunizations. The vaccines that were due at the time of visit were Td, Measles, Mumps and Rubella, and Varicella. Discussed injections to be given with other nurse. Was discussed that MMR and Varicella should be given separate and in separate arms. Went to prepare vaccines, and a different nurse was consulted about giving the patient MMRV instead of MMR and Varicella separately to avoid the patient getting multiple injections. Was told to give MMRV. Further information about the patient such as her age was not discussed prior to giving the MMRV injection.
SYMPTOM1: Product administered to patient of inappropriate age

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Developed measles rash, high temperatures, vomiting, lethargic, sick for two weeks. Now he has anxiety. He gets sick all the time.
Developed measles rash, high temperatures, vomiting, lethargic, sick for two weeks. Now he has anxiety. He gets sick all the time.
Injection site reaction starting about 8 hours after injection around the Proquad injection with warmth redness swelling and pain.

Patient came into the clinic on 02/13/2019. Mom had noticed redness and swelling in the right thigh on 02/12/2019. No fever. Provider noted erythema and swelling localized around previous bandage and injection site of the INFANRIX on left lateral thigh. The area was warm to touch, tender and a 10 cm diameter. Dr diagnosed the patient with cellulitis and treated with Keflex.

2/12/19 Saw Dr., right arm swelled, itchy and red up to the collarbone area, unsure if cellulitis or vaccine reaction so started on cephalexin. 2/14/19 Went to Hospital because now had blisters along with continued swelling, diagnosed with an Arthus reaction and antibiotics were stopped.
SYMPTOM5: Type III immune complex mediated reaction

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This non-valid spontaneous report was received from a nurse and refers to an unspecified number of unspecified patients. The patients' pertinent medical history, drug reactions, allergies and concomitant medications were not reported. On an unknown dates, the patients were vaccinated with improperly stored PROQUAD, GARDASIL 9, ROTATEQ, PNEUMOVAX 23, all for prophylaxis (lots# and expiration dates were not provided). PROQUAD was reconstituted with improperly stored sterile diluent (manufacturer unknown). No adverse effects were reported. Temperature and time frame of the excursion were not provided and there was no previous excursion. The digital data logger was involved. Follow up information has been received from the nurse on 16-JAN-2019. Lots# and expiration dates for the improperly stored vaccines were provided. PROQUAD lot# non valid reported as N55860, expiration date reported as 02-MAR-2018, excursion date: from 05-JUL-2017 till 29-JUL-2017) (temperature of excursion (T) ranged from 36 to 46 degree Celsius for 1.5 to 12 hours (h)), lot# R008196, expiration date: 16-SEP-2019 and lot# R012416, expiration date: 28-OCT-2019, excursion dates: from 02-JUL-2018 to 03-OCT-2018, T 9-10 degree Fahrenheit for 2-25 h), lot # non valid reported as E98765, expiration date reported as 01-JAN-20XX (T 6-14 degree Fahrenheit for 3 days, and 47 to 77 degree Fahrenheit for 2 h) administered on an unknown dates. GARDASIL 9 (lot# non valid reported as H12345, expiration date reported as 04-JUL-20xx, T 68 Fahrenheit for 1 month), lot# non valid reported as K08421, expiration date reported as 12-SEP-2018, excursion date: from 01-JUN-2017 to 18-JUL-2017, T range from 28 to 33 degree Celsius, for 0.5 to 8 h) vaccinated on 05-JUN-2017, 08-JUL-2017 and 22-JUL-2017, lot# R017134, expiration date: 29-APR-2021 (excursion date: 31-OCT-2018, T 34 degree Fahrenheit, 8 h), lot# R020947, expiration date: 04-MAY-2021 (excursion date: 31-OCT-2018, T 34 degree Fahrenheit, 8 h) and lot# R017457, expiration date: 10-APR-2021 (excursion dates: from 02-NOV-2018 to 19-DEC-2018, T 33-47 degree Fahrenheit, 5-8 h). ROTATEQ (lot# N030996, expiration date: 08-SEP-2019, and lot# R012957, expiration date: 11-JUN-2019, excursion dates: from 31-OCT-2018, to 19-DEC-2018, T 33-47 degree Fahrenheit, 5-8 h. PNEUMOVAX 23 (lot# non valid reported as G67891, expiration date reported as 31-DEC-20xx, T 22 degree Fahrenheit for 3 h), (lot# R027299, expiration date: 09-APR-2020, excursion date: 19-DEC-2018, T 47 degree Fahrenheit, 8 h), (lot# R011632, expiration date: 02-FEB-2020, excursion dates: 02-NOV-2018, T 33 T 33-47 degree Fahrenheit, 5-8 h, 5h and 28-NOV-2018, 47 T 33-47 degree Fahrenheit, 5-8 h, 8h). The patients were also vaccinated with improperly stored ZOSTAVAX, lot # non valid reported as E34567, expiration date reported as 28-FEB-20XXm T 6-14 degree Fahrenheit, for 120 h) on an unknown dates. The primary reporter nurse confirmed that the sterile diluent used to reconstitute the PROQUAD was not improperly stored (considered as concomitant therapy).

This spontaneous report as received from a consumer via company representative refers to her daughter, a female patient of unknown age. There was no information about the patient's concurrent conditions, concomitant therapies or past medical history provided. This spontaneous report as received from a medical assistant refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. No information regarding the patient's pertinent medical history, drug reactions or allergies and concomitant medications was provided. SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient got her immunizations on 2/12/19 and started to have some reactions on 2/13/19 PM. Mother said that patient started to get redness at injection sights and was complaining of pain at injection sights. She states there was heat to the touch as well as some swelling. Mother called the office and was advised to give patient Ibuprofen and ice the sights. It helped with the reaction on the right leg but the left leg reaction is still present. They came in the office for an appointment and was advised by Dr. to continue with Ibuprofen and ice and she told mother she could give patient BENADRYL. The reaction on the left leg was 3 cm and the right leg was less than a quarter.
PRIOR_VAX: Patient's mother said that patient has had some redness to previous vaccines as well as a knot where it was given but did not sp

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Injection 2.12.19 to right posterior arm; Began to sweat around 10 am; Swelling, redness, hot to touch with induration to right posterior arm around 1400. Swelling continued with fever 100.1 on 2. 13.19. Fatigue, increased swelling to arm to 6 x 9 inches in a somewhat oval shape; 2.14.19 notifed MD suggested warm compresses; 2.15.19 continued fatigue, swelling, warmth, no larger at this time in size.

Significant arm swelling from shoulder down to the elbow, redness.
My son broke out in a horrible rash all over his entire body.

My daughter had a fever, her body broke out in a rash that was constantly moving around her body. Lesions associated with her disease Mastocystosis, started to form. She was extremely itchy and uncomfortable. None of her medication was working to calm her symtpoms (which these medications work for all our issues related to her disesase). I took her to the emergency room and they were unsure because the reaction was so late. She was given a steroid to calm the reaction which worked. The very next day the same reaction came back with the fever and rash. I took her back to the emergency room. We were then prescribed the steroid. We followed up 10.20.16 with a dermatologist.
CUR_ILL: No illnesses, just the disease she was born with Cutaneous Mastocytosis Urticara Pigmentosa.
ALLERGIES: Has Cutaneous Mastocytosis Urticara Pigmentosa. We follow a low histamine diet, nut free, gluten free and limited dairy.

Pt came for doctor's office visit for routine well care check on 2/8/19. 4 yo vaccines administered per routine. KINRIX, MMRV and flu administered. Pt tolerated well post vaccination. KINRIX administered in Right deltoid, MMRV administered LUOA, Flu vaccine administered Left deltoid. Pt complained of Right arm redness, swelling 2/10/19 and was taken to ED on 2/11/19 by mother. SYMPTOM_TEXT: Pt presented to office for a nurse visit with a school form vaccine checklist indicating he was due for DTaP, IPV, Hep B, MMR, and Varicella. The other MA and myself did not catch that the pt was too old to receive a DTaP. The CDC indicates that the DTaP can count as a TDaP in this case, and re-vaccination is not necessary.
SYMPTOM1: Product administered to patient of inappropriate age

SYMPTOM_TEXT: 5 YO female had a physical exam within normal limit, received 4 YO vaccines KINRIX, PROQUAD, Influenza, 3 minutes after vaccines were given the mom called out for help and the patient was on the floor with arm stiffness and then crying. Lock rolled patient to left side, checked pupils they were equal react to light briskly. Patient was moved to an exam table. Patient was breathing spontaneously with no distress. Pulse oximetry showed Pulse 98, BP: 130/91 Glucose via finger stick was 98. Patient was responsive neuro checks at baseline, paramedics were called. Patient was continuously monitored until paramedics arrived. Mother was informed and updated. Parents were advised to have the paramedics take the patient to ED for further evaluation. The father refused and wanted to take the patient home. Father and Mother were both advised on seeking immediate medical care if further signs of seizure or altered neuro status.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: 4.4 cm x 2.6 cm oval-shaped erythematous, slightly indurated, and warm plaque on the left lateral upper arm at the deltoid, with some overlying scaling. It is only mildly tender, but not significant. Because of the itchiness, I prescribed triamcinolone 0.025% topical ointment to be applied twice daily for up to 7 days I discussed the use of ice to the area for 10-15 minutes at a time for comfort, and the use of analgesics like Tylenol or ibuprofen as needed. Will report to VAERS. She does not have another DTaP vaccine until she is 11 years old, when she will receive the Tdap, and I think this is likely okay at that time.

24 hours after shots my daughter was have some strange behavior. She was hitting herself in the face, digging in her mouth, bitting down on her pacifier really aggressively, crying, insomnia, loss of appetite, the next day she was have seizure like activity all morning. That night the seizure like activity lasted over 3 min and she had 3 different episodes. She stopped breathing for a moment. We took her to two different Emergency Rooms and her primary care that day but they told us it was because of a fever. There was no fever noted.

Both, PROQUAD and of VARIVAX were reconstituted with sterile diluent (MERCK) lot number M041688 and expiration date 12-JUN-2019. SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. The patient's medical history and concurrent conditions were not provided. Concomitant therapies included sterile diluent. On 06-FEB-2019, the patient who was only supposed to receive a dose of PROQUAD (per subcutaneous route, lot# R002676; expiration date 15-JAN-2020 for prophylaxis) was also inadvertently administered a dose of VARIVAX (lot# R007695, expiration date 14-MAR-2020 for prophylaxis). The reporting medical assistant mentioned the error occurred because the provider who was administering the doses knew that the patient was due to be vaccinated for measles/mumps/rubella and varicella, but she did not notice that PROQUAD contains both, and essentially thinking that the dose of PROQUAD was a dose of M-M-R II), and therefore thought she needed to administer a dose of VARIVAX as well. No adverse effect reported. Lot Number R002676 is NOT valid for PROQUAD.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This non-valid spontaneous report was received from a nurse, and refers to unspecified patients of unknown age and gender. No information was provided regarding the patients' medical history, previous drug reactions, allergies, concurrent conditions or concomitant medications. It was reported that between 26-NOV-2018 and 07-FEB-019, one patient received improperly stored VARIVAX (lot # R017640, expiration date 20-JUN-2020 and lot # R02241, expiration date 14-JAN-2019), and two patients received improperly stored PROQUAD (lot # R014353, expiration date 18-NOV-2019), both for prophylaxis (route, dose, and anatomical location were not provided). The vaccines were reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent. There were no previous temperature excursions. Lot number R02241 is an invalid lot number for VARIVAX.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This is a literature case, initially received on 19-Feb-2019, concerning a 2-year-old, male child. The study describes the reports of anaphylaxis after vaccination reported to the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS) during 1990-2016. A descriptive analysis, including history of hypersensitivity (anaphylaxis, respiratory allergies, and drug allergies) and vaccines given were performed. The patient's medical history included premature birth at 33 weeks of gestation, hypoplastic left heart syndrome with subsequent cavopulmonary shunt procedure. The current conditions of the patient included periodic cyanosis. On an unspecified date, the patient was administered INN Flu Vaccine Seasonal (anatomical location, dose, route of administration, batch number, manufacturer, trade name and expiry date: not reported) for an unknown indication. On the same day, the patient was also administered a combined non-company suspect vaccine, Measles vaccine;Mumps vaccine;Rubella vaccine;Varicella zoster vaccine (anatomical location, dose, route of administration, batch number, manufacturer, trade name and expiry date: not reported) for an unknown indication. On the same day, 20 minutes after the vaccination, the patient experienced a cardiopulmonary arrest and the patient died. Autopsy was performed, and the cause of death was reported as anaphylactic reaction (related). On post-mortem laboratory tests revealed an increased serum tryptase level. The outcome of the event cardiopulmonary arrest was not reported. The reporter assessed this case as serious (death).; Reporter's Comments: A 2-year-old, male patient with medical history/concurrent condition (premature birth at 33 weeks of gestation, hypoplastic left heart syndrome with subsequent cavopulmonary shunt procedure and periodic cyanosis) experienced fatal cardiopulmonary arrest, 20 minutes after administration of INN Flu Vaccine. The autopsy reported the cause of death as anaphylactic reaction. The case meets level 2 of Brighton Collaboration criteria of diagnostic certainty for anaphylactic reaction. Considering the plausible temporal relationship between vaccination and reported fatal events (anaphylactic reaction and cardiopulmonary arrest) and lack of alternative more plausible causes, the company conservatively assessed the events as possibly related to suspect vaccine. However, co-administered combined measles, mumps, rubella and varicella vaccine was considered as non company suspect in this case. The company assessed the event 'anaphylactic reaction' as serious (medically significant).; Reported Cause(s) of Death: Anaphylactic reaction.
LAB_DATA: Test Name: Serum tryptase level; Result Unstructured Data: Increased.

OTHER_MEDS: MOP states none at this time.
HISTORY: MOP states none at this time.
ALLERGIES: MOP states none at this time.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report as received from a nurse refers to a 4-years-old patient of unknown gender. No information regarding the patient's pertinent medical history, concomitant medication, drug reactions and allergies was provided. On 22-OCT-2015, the patient, at the age of 12 months, was vaccinated with the first dose of PROQUAD, albumin status recombinant Human albumin (rHA), injection, subcutaneously, in left lateral tight, lot number L023111, expiration date 24-DEC-2016, for prophylaxis (exact dose was not reported). On 13-NOV-2018, the patient, at the age of 4-year-old, was vaccinated with the second dose of PROQUAD, albumin status recombinant Human albumin (rHA), injection, subcutaneously, in left lateral tight, lot number R022568, expiration date 04-FEB-2020, for prophylaxis (exact dose was not reported). On 08-FEB-2019, the patient, at the age of 4-year-old, the third dose of PROQUAD, albumin status recombinant Human albumin (rHA), injection, was administrated inadvertently (subcutaneous, in left lateral tight, lot number R011803, expiration date 21-OCT-2019). No adverse effects were reported.

Patient developed redness/itchiness on 2/14/19 on left and right upper arms at sites of immunizations. Mom reports he was scratching a lot and his upper two arms became swollen, painful, and warm over the next 2 days. He developed a fever, and given the redness/swelling at the site, Mom brought him to Emergency Department on 2/15/19. He had no cough, difficulty breathing, vomiting, diarrhea, or rash on other parts of his body. In the ER, he had about a 10cm area of warmth, erythema, and swelling extending from shoulder to upper triceps on left upper extremity and a 4-5cm area of erythema and swelling on right upper extremity, consistent with cellulitis. An ultrasound of the area of erythema/induration on his arms showed no fluid collection. Due to the rapid progression of the erythema and fever, he was admitted for IV antibiotic therapy. IV clindamycin was continued throughout his admission and switched to PO once he showed signs of clinical improvement. He was discharged with improved symptoms on 2/17/19 to complete a 7 day course of PO clindamycin. He followed up in clinic on 2/28/19 and swelling/erythema had completely resolved.
LAB_DATA: 2/15/19 Ultrasound of left upper extremity: "Within the area of concern in the left upper arm, there is soft tissue subcutaneous edema with cobblestoning and hyperemia. There is interstitial fluid tracking along fascial planes, although there is no collection or abscess.
ALLERGIES: No known drug allergies; No known food allergies; Allergy testing in 04/2017 showed allergy to dust mites

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report as received from a medical assistant refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. No information regarding patient's pertinent medical history, drug reactions, allergies and concomitant medications was reported. On unknown date, the patient was vaccinated with PROQUAD, albumin status of rHA (recombinant human albumin), (lot # R015739, expiration date: 02-DEC-2019), dose, route of administration and injection site were not provided), for prophylaxis. It was unknown if the sterile diluent (lot# and expiration date were not provided) used to reconstitute the vaccine was stored properly. On unknown date, the vaccine was stored in temperature -9 Celsius degrees to +8 Celsius degrees, for 36 hours and 27 minutes. There was previous temperature excursion: from -14 Celsius degrees to 10 Celsius degrees, for 3 hours and 6 minutes. The digital data logger was involved. There were no adverse effects.

This spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse, and refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. No information was provided regarding the patient's medical history, previous drug reactions, allergies, concurrent conditions or concomitant medications. It was reported that on 15-JAN-2019, the patient received an improperly stored dose of PROQUAD (Lot # R012416 and expiration date 28-OCT-2019), subcutaneously (dose and anatomical location were not reported) for prophylaxis. The dose of PROQUAD was exposed to a temperature excursion of 11.9 Fahrenheit (F) during a timeframe of 117 hours, which was detected by a digital data logger. The vaccine was reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent. There were no previous temperature excursions. No adverse event. This is one of seven reports received from the same reporter. Redness at injection site.

LAB_DATA: None were done. Looked at us like we were nuts and called it a virus.
PRIOR_VAX: 5/2016 polio hep b age 6 months. Stopped rolling and sitting had no muscle control.

CUR_ILL: Right otitis media and left conjunctivitis in January 2019

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Feb. 4 rash appeared on right shoulder, it seemed very sensitive to the touch as he would shy away from me if I tried to touch that shoulder (looked like chicken pox, I have a photo from Feb. 6) rash became more concentrated and scabby but no longer sensitive to touch(I have a photo from Feb. 21, Feb. 27, and today Mar. 10), the rash seems less thick now and possibly fading but still present. Feb. 4 to Feb. 7 fever ranging from 102 -103 able to be brought down with tylenol and ibuprofen, fever worse at night. Lethargy, decreased appetite, very clingy and fussy Feb. 7 to about Feb.11 severe nasal congestion, unable to nurse. He's never had such severe nasal congestion to the point he couldn't nurse, sleep unless sitting up, etc. Feb. 11 until present has been acting as if right ear is hurting him. Puts his finger in his ear, pulls his hair, hits himself in the head, cries, fussy and clingy. Mar 6 to present severe nasal congestion again. Not as bad as in February but having trouble nursing, sleeping, etc. Sleeping more during the day than normal, appetite decreased, rash still present on right shoulder.
LAB_DATA: Feb. 13 doctor exam diagnosed right ear infection; Feb. 21 doctor exam diagnosed right ear infection still present; Blood draw 3/8/2019; Going to another doctor exam on 3/12/2019

On 2-28-19 per mom via telephone L arm is warm to touch underneath injection site and earlier in am was red but is no longer red, no lump - advised to monitor - On 3-1-18 area has gotten bigger (tender, warm, itches) on exam L upper arm below deltoid with large cellulitis (stops about 2 in above elbow). 9x9cm, warm, +edema, tender w/movement but has full ROM, no streaking.
LAB_DATA: 3-1-19 diagnosed with Cellulitis treated with AUGMENTIN ES 600 Oral Susp give 6 mls bid for 10 days. On 3-2-19 per mom the swelling is receding after starting antibiotic.

The fever waned by days 3-4 post vaccine, and on the evening of day 5, mom noticed "bumps" of rash on the child's neck and chest after her bath. Mom called the morning of day 6 post vaccine, and the child is developing more lesions on her back and near hairline. The bumps are itchy, no vesicular "blisters" yet.

Within 10 mins of injections, 11:05. patient started coughing to the point of almost puking. Very wet sounding. He then started to yell his feet hurt and pulled his shoes off to start scratching. Within another 5 minutes his entire body was red and covered in hives. Took him to ER and they gave him epinephrine at 12:07, dexamethasone (Decasron) at 12:15, Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) at 12:14 and famotidine (pepcid) at 1:14.
LAB_DATA: Will be visiting an allergist on 3/19/2019 and find out what drug he was allergic to.
OTHER_MEDS: Singular, Flonase, Albuterol. No medicines were taken morning before vaccines

SYMPTOM_TEXT: 5 days after patient given MMRV (PROQUAD). She developed swelling left side of face (mumps like swelling of left parotid gland 5 x 6 cm in size). Had fever 2-3 days prior.
Injection site was very warm to touch, swollen, and was painful.
After vaccine was administered 4 days after, I noticed little bumps on her forehead and over her legs. This is not the first time she's gotten these bumps after vaccination.

First of all, pt was given shots in both arms, yet the person who filled out the paper work took a short cut and said she only got her shots in the left arm. Pt got her shots and then went to school, when i picked her up at 2:15 pm on 4/12/16 from school she said she wasn't feeling well and felt warm. I took her home and took her temp, she was at 102. I did not treat the fever. At 4pm she told me there were snakes crawling on her stomach, she was having hallucinations and had a fever of 104.6; at this point I gave her ibuprofin for her size. Her fever would only drop to 101. She had fever for 3 days. On the night of 4/12/16 pt also was complaining of weak arms and legs and that they were hurting. To this very day she has severe leg pains. On June 12, 2016 pt was displaying symptoms to Type 1 Diabetes. She was extremely thirsty, urinating freqently, had a ketone smell on her breath and was losing weight. We tested her blood sugar and she was 436, she was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes later that week.
LAB_DATA: During the week of 6/13/2016 she had many tests done to confirm she has Type 1 Diabetes
PRIOR_VAX: Following her 4 month vaccines she cried for over 4 hours and didn't want to eat for 24 hours. The following few weeks she was a

Report by parent (father) on Monday (3/11/2019) four hours after immunization administration the upper left arm began to be itchy and red, fever and swelling began after midnight, had fever on Tuesday and child was trying to scratch at arm. No fever today but still swollen, maybe less red.  No pus or discharge at site of injection. EXAM: 4"X4" moderately erythematous and mildly warm to touch swollen upper left extremity. Provider drew a border with surgical pen around erythematous area in order to monitor for next 48 hours. Prescribed AUGMENTIN ES 600mg/5ml sig. 5ml orally every 12 hours for 10 days; Diphenhydramine HCl 12.5mg/5ml sig. 6ml orally q 6 hours as needed for itch; Ibuprofen 100mg/5ml sig. 6ml orally every 8 hours as needed for pain or fever.  Instructed parent to monitor and return to clinic for increasing redness, increased swelling, return of fever.

Patient complained of pain in bottom and started acting like she was having difficulty breathing. Symptoms progressed to redness, facial swelling, hives, decreased oxygen saturation and wheezing. Symptoms responded to Epinephrine and BENADRYL. Patient monitored in office for one hour. Patient's oxygen increased, swelling decreased and mild hives on cheeks.
HISTORY: large hemangioma into bladder and vagina followed by Dr. was on INDERAL; tethered cord; rectal vaginal fistula; subglottal stenosis (50% narrowed); Triple X syndrome- per mother not too much information speech and developmental delay, watch for mood changes, tall in stature

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Information has been received from a medical assistant referring to an unspecified patient. Information about concomitant medications, pertinent medical history and drug reactions/allergies was not reported. On an unknown date, unspecified patients were inadvertently administered doses of VARIVAX (lot#: R018933, Expiration Date: 02-JUL-2020) and PROQUAD (lot#: R022564, Expiration Date: 04-FEB-2020; lot#: R022573, Expiration Date: 04-FEB-2020) for prophylaxis. All lots of VARIVAX and PROQUAD were reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent. The administered doses experienced a temperature excursion at 32.9F for 13 hours. Previous excursions were reported as from 15F to 46F (16F) for 1 hour. The temperature excursions were detected by a data logger (Product storage error). Other suspect therapies included PEDVAXHIB (lot#: R014262, Expiration Date: 26-MAR-2021; lot#:R013572, expiration date: 21-Mar-2021). The administered doses experienced a temperature excursion at 48.4F for 15 minutes. Previous excursions were reported as total time and highest temperature above 47F/9 degree for 9 hours. No adverse effect reported. This is a non-valid case due to not have identifiable patient.
High fever with febrile seizures 9 days after MMR. Walked in on a blue baby on day 10.

Patient received vaccines on  2/14/19. Patient returned to clinic for follow-up vaccines on 3/15/19. Patient presented with a rash that began on 2/15/19 on his hands and spread to his arms, torso, and legs. He reported no other problems, including fever, myalgias, or difficulty breathing. Rash appeared to be a combination of large red raised wheals (1-3 inches in diameter) and small scabbed papules. Patient reported  the rash was pruritic and scabbed areas were likely as a result of scratching. He reported having a family member in the home, age 12, who had a similar rash and had not received vaccines. He had not received any other follow up or treatment for the rash or any other problems. Vaccination was deferred and patient was referred to a primary care provider for follow-up.

Episodes of staring into space, lasting 2-15 minutes at a time, he would look up and to the side, and sometimes have repetitive head movements back and forth. Would not respond to name, noise, visual stimulus, or physical stimulus. Would spontaneously come out of it and act as if nothing happened. This has been occurring daily, sometimes multiple times a day. Patient also having episodes where he repetitively move hands and head, and lips, lasting about 30 seconds to 2 minutes. No loss of bowel or bladder control. Patient has also been more fatigued, going to bed earlier, falling asleep at dinner table, sleeping longer. Also more irritable and throwing more temper tantrums, with resolution only when being put to bed.

Fever for two days immediately following vaccine. 5 days later, she broke out in a rash on her face, chest, stomach, back, arms, and legs. It has been over 2 weeks since her vaccine and she still has the rash, and has run a fever for 2 days and also has diarrhea. The diarrhea has caused a terrible diaper rash on top of all other issues.
The day after vaccines, pt developed 12 cm redness at site of MMRV vaccine. Itchy, painfull and warm to touch. Given TYLENOL/MOTRIN and BENADRYL.

Same day as shots spiked an extremely high fever 103 and a rash near injection. Called nurses hotline at Clinic was told this is normal. Next day even higher fever 104, full body rash and began to sieze. Took her to the ER. They gave her TYLENOL and prescribed TYLENOL and MOTRIN for fever. Was told to follow up with PCM. Her rash did not go away and she seized on and off. By the time we saw her PCM her rash was going down and her seizure had stopped. Was told by the PCM that she doesn't have anymore vaccines for a while so she should be OK she has complained of her legs hurting and we monitor her for seizures anytime her temperature gets high.

There was a purple circle of bruising around the administration site.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This spontaneous report as received from a medical assistant refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. There was no information about the patient's pertinent medical history, concomitant therapies or drug reactions and allergies provided. On 20-FEB-2019, the patient was vaccinated with a dose of improperly stored PROQUAD injection, lot # R006216 with expiration date 28-AUG-2019, subcutaneously for prophylaxis. The dose of the vaccines were reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent. The vaccine experienced a temperature excursion from -14 degrees Celsius to -10 degrees Celsius for 30 minutes. The digital data logger was involved in recording the temperature excursion details. No previous temperature excursion had occurred. No adverse effect was reported.

Rash all over body, fever, runny nose, cough. Friday the 8th he got 2 shots in his left arm. KINRIX and MMRV. He ended up getting a rash Friday (the 8th) night. I noticed it....called the on call doctor, she's was like ohhh it's probably just a reaction to the shots, keep an eye on him, look for swelling and whatnot. Ok....so I did. Monday the 11th rolls around.... he still has the rash and he tells me Monday night that his neck hurts. I go into full blown panic thinking meningitis or something awful, rush him to the peds urgent care, they say it's scarlet fever and give him amoxicillin. No strep swab, he was only examined. He's was done the antibiotic on the Thursday the 21st and the rash is back, full force as of Thursday (before the last dose of antibiotics) So, I called the nurse at his office, sent pics and they diagnosed it as a 'Non-Specific Viral Rash' she said since they didn't do a strep swab at urgent care she can't be sure that's what he had, but if he was on antibiotics it should have gone away if it was. So she basically said keep an eye on it and bring him in tomorrow or Saturday if it gets worse or if he gets a fever... I'm bringing him back to the doctor tomorrow, Saturday the 23rd. He has a runny nose, a cough and a rash now.

Extreme fatigue (sleeping continually), poor appetite, high fever (up to 103.7), extreme shaking, headache, symptoms lasting 5+ days, sore throat, red rash on face, night sweats. Treated with rest, liquids, and TYLENOL.

SubQ site did not have any visible abnormalities. Both IM injection sites were red, swollen, and warm. R deltoid is documented at 6cm annular erythema, no induration. Ice/Cold therapy and NSAIDs recommended for swelling and pain reduction. Return to clinic if not improved.

Vaccine was given and within 1-2 minutes of receiving it patient reported itching on her legs. Leg was rechecked and redness and a small hive was noted so Provider was asked to come see the reaction and advise further. Ice pack was placed on the reaction site and reaction was monitored for 15 minutes to confirm there was no worsening or anaphylactic reaction. After this time patient reported the itching had stopped and she was stable to return home. Mom instructed on what to watch for and asked to return for any worsening symptoms.
LAB_DATA: Patient returned to the clinic on Thursday 3-28-19 with her mother for continued and worsening redness and swelling to the left thigh. Mom stated that they had gone for a walk the night before and she noted that patient's left leg looked "buldged" from behind so when she got her home she looked at her leg and noted the redness, swelling and that the area was hot to the touch.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: After receiving immunizations, family was waiting their 15 minutes in the lobby area when child's grandmother walked into the clinic and informed PHN and PHN that child had spit-up. PHN assisted child by removing the small amount of clear mucous, < 1 ounce, from the child's face with a paper towel. 10:45 am: PHN completed assessment of child VS: Apical HR 88, RR 36, Temp 97.2, BP 90/70. Lung sounds clear bilaterally, good aeration. No redness, swelling, or hives at or around injection site. No respiratory distress or generalized hives. Child was alert and responded to verbal commands during assessment. Child rested and was reading a book. No further episodes of spitting-up . Reviewed S/S of severe allergic reaction (swelling of the face, mouth or throat; difficulty breathing and generalized hives) and response with parent prior to releasing family at 11:15am. Child left walking with father and grandmother in no apparent distress.

This spontaneous report as received from a nurse refers to a 4 year old patient, of unknown gender. Patient's current conditions, medical history, concomitant medications, drugs allergies or reactions were not reported. On 18-MAR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with improperly stored dose of the following vaccine: PROQUAD, lot # R022568, expiration date 04-FEB-2020, (strength, dose, dose number, route and anatomical location were not provided) for prophylaxis. No improperly stored sterile diluent used was reported. The vaccine was exposed to a temperature of 6 Fahrenheit degrees to 14 Fahrenheit degrees (12.9 Fahrenheit degrees) for 66 minutes. There was a previous temperature excursion from 6 Fahrenheit degrees to 14 Fahrenheit degrees (12.0 Fahrenheit degrees) for 35 minutes. It was reported that digital data logger was involved. No adverse effects were reported. This case is one of six same reporter cases. Child cried during vaccinations, then went and sat in waiting room with parent while paperwork was entered and record could be printed, child was standing by our desk, passed out and fell to the floor, unresponsive but breathing, sternal rub, responded, blue around mouth, HR 50-60, resp 6, 911 called, Epi 0.2 administered at 2:40 pm. EMS arrived at 2:50, child was awake, slow to respond, neck was supported, HR 96-100, resp 10, interpreter called and asked mother further questions if this had happened in previous country since they did not have their records, she answered no. EMS left with child to Hospital, mother in ambulance. Hospital called said she was ok, they thought it could have been a vagal response.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This non-valid spontaneous report as received from a nurse and refers to an unspecified number of patients of unknown age and gender. There was no information about the patients' concurrent conditions, concomitant therapies or medical histories provided. On unknown dates, the patients were vaccinated with improperly stored doses of VARIVAX with lot # R017944, expiration date 24-JUN-2020, lot# N026073, expiration date 20-SEP-2019, lot# N023960, expiration date 01-SEP-2019 (dose and route of administration were not reported) or PROQUAD with lot# R017800, expiration date 19-DEC-2019 and lot# N035934, expiration date 16-JUN-2019 (dose and route of administration were not reported). The vaccines were reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent, lot# R022280, expiration date 06-OCT-2019. There was no adverse effect reported. Administered doses of vaccines experienced the temperature excursion between 6 to 14 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 minutes and between 15 to 46 (also reported as 20) degrees Fahrenheit for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Data logger was involved. There were no previous excursions reported. Product quality complaint (PQC) was not involved. The case is non-valid due to lack of the patients' identifiers. Follow up information was received from a nurse on 27-MAR-2019. The Nurse stated that she had spoken with management after calling in the data logger excursion. Management denied permission to provide patient identifiers and dates of vaccination for the patients that were vaccinated with the above products after being involved in a data logger excursion. No further information is available.

Child was given shots at 2:05 p.m. per protocol, child was up talking and playing, then stated he didn't feel good, child fainted,  noticed child was very pale, emergency cart obtained, O2sat/74, B/P 98/60, P)92, R)16, lips turning blue, no s/s of SOB, Rash, or seizures, Oxygen applied at 2/LM via face mask, 2:30 p.m. B/P)100/70, P)100, o2sat/85%, R)14, child talking and laughing, fainted again.  Epinephrine 0.15 prepared, ambulance called, oxygen increased to 4/LM, EMA arrives, child talking at this time, faints again and EMT increase oxygen to 6/LM via blow by method, child still groggy and in/out of conversations, child taken to Center via ambulance with Mother/Father/Brother following.  Epinephrine 0.15 wasted, d/t EMA in building, and not needed. PC to mother at 4:30, reported just left ER, child doing fine, color back to normal, lips pink, and playing with dad/brother. Mom encouraged to follow up with child PMD/Dr. On Monday Morning 04/01/2019; has not made appointment as of today 04/01/2019, encouraged to do so.
ALLERGIES: No drug allergies, has environmental allergies

low white blood cell count; a 13 year old male patient received PROQUAD; hallucinations (like dreams but not dreaming); HEADACHE; Fever to 101 degrees fahrenheit (constant then intermittent); unspecified number of Bloody noses; lethargy; epigastric pain; chest pain; decreased appetite; dizziness with standing; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse, referring to a 13 year old male patient. The patient's concurrent conditions were not reported. The patient did not have any concomitant therapies, significant medical history or drug allergies/reactions. The patient's historical drugs included behind on vaccination.  On 25-MAR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with albumin status rHA (recombinant Human albumin) Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) lot# N035172, expiration date 09-JUN-2019, for prophylaxis (strength, dose, route and frequency were not reported), hepatitis A virus vaccine inactivated (HAVRIX) (strength, dose, route, frequency, lot#, expiration date and indication were not reported) and poliovirus vaccine inactivated (Vero) (IPOL) (strength, dose, route, frequency, lot#, expiration date and indication were not reported).  Between 28-MAR-2019 and 01-APR-2019, the patient developed headache, hallucinations described like dreams but not dreaming, fever to 101 degrees Fahrenheit, constant then intermittent (pyrexia), unspecified number of bloody noses (epistaxis), lethargy, epigastric and chest pain (abdominal pain upper and chest pain) with decreased appetite, and dizziness with standing (dizziness postural).  The patient did stay home from school and did not go to an emergency room or urgent care center, but sought medical attention and was seen by the physician assistant on 02-APR-2019.   On an unknown date in April 2019, a complete blood count with a electrolytes test was performed with normal results, except for a low white blood cell count. It was stated that the patient did not have a previous immunization reaction.  On 05-APR-2019, the physician assistant spoke with the parent and stated that the patient was back in school with no further symptoms (recovered). The patient did not receive any treatment.  The causality assessment was not provided.

Mom called around 4:30 stating that clients leg  started to swell and has become worse and that client may have a fever because she feels warm but has not taken clients temperature. Nurse at Public Health asked if client was having any wheezing, problems breathing, or swelling of the face. Nurse explained to mom that client is having a local reaction which may take about 3-5 days before it goes away. That mom can call her provider and find out if she can give client anything like Tylenol or Benedryl. Nurse also explained to mom that if client is having any respiratory problems or any facial swelling that she should seek emergency help as soon as possible. Mom stated she understood.

On 09-APR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with an unspecified dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live(PROQUAD) recombinant Human albumin (rHA) lot # R015738 with expiration date 02-DEC-2019, subcutaneously, for prophylaxis (strength and anatomical location were not reported). On the same date, the patient was inadvertently vaccinated with an unspecified dose of varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX), for prophylaxis (strength, route of administration, lot # and expiration date were not reported). No treatment was given to the patient and no laboratory diagnostic test was performed. It was stated that this was not a product confusion.
Fever of 103. Febrile Seizure around 4:30 PM - seen in ER, advised to give Tylenol and Motrin as needed. Continued with fever until 3-31-19.
LAB_DATA: Patient was tested for Flu A, Flu B, and RSV- all tests negative. Had C-spine xray - results were normal.
CUR_ILL: Stomach pains for 1 day. Cough for 1 month
ALLERGIES: Milk, Almond, Egg, Soy, Sesame seeds, Garlic, Tree nuts, Pistacho, nuts, Peanuts

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient presented for the first time after 10/11/18 vaccinations on 11/01/2018 complaining of scattered, scaly rash all over trunk, chest wall, and legs. Office note states mother noticed a swollen area on left upper thigh approximately 1 or 2 days prior to this office visit.  The nurse's note states that the site was swollen, warm and tender to touch, without drainage. Patient was afebrile. The diagnoses for this date was pruritis, tinea corporis, and cutaneous abscess of left lower limb. Medications prescribed at this visit were Griseofulvin, Sulfamethazole-Trimethoprim, and topical Mupirocin. On 12/6/2018 patient returned to office complaining of bilateral eyelid swelling and eye pain. She was afebrile and denied cough. Medications continued were Griseofulvin and topical Ketoconazole 2% for the tinea rash. Zaditor and Cetirizine were also added.  She still complained that the left thigh abscess had not resolved and was referred to wound care with Dr. Office notes on 12/7/19 state that mother noticed lesion on left thigh 3 weeks prior to the office visit and stated that child did not have any pain at that time. Notes state the lesion on that date measured 1x1x1cm with serosanguineous drainage, red granulation, and subcutaneous tissue exposed. The wound was cleaned and dressed.  Child returned to pediatrician?s office on 2/7/19 with rash, cough and congestion. She was diagnosed with viral URI, hives, contact dermatitis, pruritis, left thigh abscess improved. She was prescribed Prednisolone 15mg/5ml twice daily for 5 days and Cetirizine 10 ml daily. Returned to Pediatrician?s office on 2/22/19 for skin peeling of hands and feet. Complained of burning skin. She was diagnosed with Eczema and Allergic Rhinitis. Patient was prescribed topical hydrocortisone 2.5% cream bid for 5-10 days and Children?s Loratadine 5ml once daily. Returned to Pediatrician 3/21/19 for congestion and ear pain. She had an ear infection and was prescribed Augmentin 600-42.9mg/5ml for 10 days. She returned to wound care on 4/10/19 complaining of left thigh pain at site of abscess for 3 weeks duration after bumping into an object. Wound care nurse reported that the abscess on left thigh had not healed since vaccines were given on 10/11/18. Wound had serous fluid and some tenderness. The wound was cleaned dressed and patient was referred for a surgical evaluation with Dr. 4/11/19 phone note from nurse practitioner stated that mother says the wound site was healed for months then started swelling again so she went back wound care to have it checked. She stated her allergies were also flaring again causing her eyes to swell. She was prescribed Zaditor eye drops and advised to continue Cetirizine.

Pt received vaccines in error. pt was here for check up today with sibling. After mom signed consent form she told medical assistant she wanted to step out of the exam room with the older sibling so the younger sibling can get the vaccines. mom ended up stepping out with the younger sibling so Patient received the four vaccines instead of just getting one. Dad was in the room when vaccines were given and did not identify the child as Patient the older sibling. The medical assistant realized the error and inform the doctor immediately and she spoke with the parents. called mom to check in the next day with pt. per mom pt is doing well, no side effects of vaccines.

Pt developed redness, swelling and pain at the site of injection (arm). Pt seen at urgent care and felt to have a vaccine reaction. Parents insisted on antibiotics. Pt seen for F/U 2 wks after vaccine given-minimal discoloration remained (redness/purple).
Redness/Swelling/rash 4/11/19 at injection site. Pt. reports itching at the site, along with above rash/Swelling and Redness

Runny nose and congestion day following vaccines until now (10 days after), fever of 102 eight days after vaccines lasting two days, and rash on back/torso/neck/face present 9 days after vaccines and still present at 10 days after vaccines. Treated fever with Tylenol, and not treating the rash because it does not seem to be bothering the baby.

Received MMRV Vaccination on 4/4/19 at 3:00 pm. On 4/6/19 approx 4 pm child began to hallucinate that bugs were crawling all over her. No fever or other symptoms present. This episode lasted roughly 9 hrs where child was tearing off clothes and attempting to remove herself from car seat as she was hallucinating that she was covered in bugs, they were biting her and crawling in and out of her anus and vagina. No bugs present. 4/9/19 after consulting with Pediatrician child was taken to Clinic. Full drug screening by urine was clear. Bloodwork done for ASO Titers and Drug Panel. Still waiting on results. Doctor suggested PANDAS. Amoxicillin was started 400 mg twice per day. 4/11/19 Received call from daycare that child was hallucinating (no fever present) and terrified that bugs were crawling all over her at about 11:00 am. 4/12/19 4:00 am Child was hallucinating that bugs were crawling all over her and absolutely terrified. Child has had blank stare since and OCD tendencies. 4/14/19 Child vomiting from approx 9:30 am to 10:15 am no fever present. Doctors appt scheduled with Pediatrics for 4/15/19 at 3:00 PM. Dr. has cleared his schedule to see her and we were advised if she continues to deteriorate to bring her to Hospital.
LAB_DATA: 4/9/19 Drug Panel-Clean; 4/9/19 ASO Titer -Waiting on Results
SYMPTOM5: Paediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders associated with streptococcal infection

SYMPTOM_TEXT: No adverse effects reported; Expired vaccine used; This spontaneous report has been received from a nurse referring to two female patients (twin girls) of unknown age. The patients' concomitant medication, pertinent medical history and drug reactions/allergies were not reported.  On 15-MAR-2019, both of the patients were vaccinated with an expired dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (lot # N024562, expiration date 06-MAR-2019; dose number and route were unknown) for prophylaxis (expired vaccine used). No adverse effects reported. The outcome of the events was unknown. No product quality compliant (PQC) presented.

No adverse effects reported; expired dose of PROQUAD was inadvertently administered; Information has been received from a medical assistant referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. Concomitant therapies included sterile diluent (STERILE DILUENT) (lot number R032352 and expiration date was on 04-JUN-2021). The patient's pertinent medical history, drug reactions/allergies and current condition were not provided.    On 21-MAR-2019 the patient was inadvertently administered an expired dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (therapy type: recombinant human albumin(rHA); lot # N025927 and expiration date was on 18-MAR-2019) subcutaneously for prophylaxis (expired product administered). No adverse effects were reported.

4 unknown patients, all over the age of 13 years old, were inadvertently administered a dose of PROQUAD (unknown lot/expiration date) on unknown dates instead of MMR II.; 4 unknown patients, all over the age of 13 years old, were inadvertently administered a dose of PROQUAD (unknown lot/expiration date) on unknown dates instead of MMR II.; No adverse effects were reported; This spontaneous report was received from a paramedical referring to 4 unknown patients, all over the age of 13 year old and unknown gender. The patients' medical history, concurrent conditions, previously drug reactions, allergies and concomitant medications were not reported.  On an unknown date, the 4 patients were inadvertently vaccinated with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live(PROQUAD) intramuscularly (dose, frequency, lot number and expiration date were not reported) for prophylaxis  instead of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live(M-M-R II) and sterile diluent was used. No adverse effects were reported.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: No adverse effects; improperly stored vaccines since 3/29/2019; This spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant, referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. There was no information about the patient's concurrent conditions, concomitant therapies, previous drug reactions, allergies or medical history.  On 29-MAR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with an improperly stored doses of varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck) (VARIVAX) lot numbers: R024024 and R024023, expiration date for both lot numbers on: 22-AUG-2020; and with (rHA) Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) lot # R030794 and R017801, expiration dates on: 22-APR-2020 and 19-DEC-2019 respectively, (dosage schedule, route, anatomical location and indication were not reported for the vaccines). The vaccines were reconstituted with properly stored diluent.   The administered doses of vaccines were exposed to a temperature of multiples excursions of 6 degrees Fahrenheit to 14 degrees Fahrenheit (minus 14 degrees Celsius to minus 10 degrees Celsius) for 100 minutes cumulative. There was no previous temperature excursion reported. The call was placed because of a Digital Data logger report. No adverse effects were reported  This is one of several reports received from the same reporter.

No adverse effects; Improperly stored (-8.89 Celsius degree for 1 hour) PROQUAD was administered to the patient; Information has been received from a medical assistant referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. Information about medical history and concurrent conditions were not provided.   On 02-APR-2019, the patient was administered improperly stored dose of Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) (lot number R020815, expiration date 16-JAN-2020; strength, dose and frequency were not reported) was subcutaneously for prophylaxis with properly stored sterile diluent (no lot information was provided). The administered dose experienced a temperature excursion of -8.89 degree Celsius for 1 hour which were detected by a data logger. No previous excursions were reported. No adverse effects was reported. SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient was healthy. Then he got the MMR vaccine, the DTAP and the pneumococcal vaccine. On December 27th 2015, he was complaining of leg pain, had a fever, just wasn't acting right. We took him in and they said it was a common reaction. Well, it wasn't. That entire year patient was so sick. Constantly getting pneumonia, fevers, leg issues. Then come Halloween of 2016, he woke up and couldn't walk. Had a very high fever and wouldn't talk. I took him to his doctor. They ran a blood test. That night at 8:00 PM on 10/31/16, his doctor called me back and said his white blood cell count was extremely low and he was neutropenic. She said the hospital was waiting for us because his blood results were leukemic. We spent an entire week in the hospital with NO definite answers. They all kept saying it was "viral". I knew it had to do with the vaccines. His behavior has changed as well. I stopped vaccinating him. Ever since I stopped, his health has improved. But he still had horrible gut issues. Can't eat any dairy or soy. He never had any problems until he got the Dr vaccines. I want him safe. My oldest son too was vaccine injured but I didn't know it back then. I just want my children safe from this poison. I almost lost him. This has to stop.
LAB_DATA: He had so many blood tests. Everything is documented.
