SYMPTOM_TEXT: had broken out in hives from "head to toe"; This spontaneous report was received from a the patient's mother, and refers to a 3 year old male patient. The patient concurrent condition included drug hypersensitivity to cefinir (OMNICEF) . The patient's medical history included eczema.     On an unknown date, in approximately 2009, when the patient had 3 years; he was vaccinated with an unspecified measles vaccine (dose, route of administration, manufacturer, lot number and expiration date were not reported) and then, on an unknown date, the patient broke out in hives from head to toe. No treatment was given but however unspecified blood work was performed with unspecified results and the patient saw a physician  On an unknown date, the patient recovered from the hives. The causal relationship between the unspecified measles vaccine and the event was not reported.

Mom reports there was blood at the time of the vaccines. on exam, significant induration and warmth of entire right upper arm.  Not tender. Distal pulses intact. Full ROM of arm.  Referred to ER for cellulitis vs  hematoma vs vaccine reaction.  Changed from amoxicillin to Keflex for likely cellulitis.  Problem resolved.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Mom reports pt had increasing emotional and balance problems. He was combative and "challenging" per mom. He has been crying with sadness.

L leg received that received KINRIX injection reportedly cleaned in sterile technique as usual prior to injection. On 4/3/19, left thigh became erythematous in small area of a few centimeters, and by the afternoon of 4/4/19, the leg become almost completely erythematous and swollen. He was referred and admitted to Medical Center, where he was treated for cellulitis with IV clindamycin, and he subsequently improved and was discharged on 4/5/19 in the afternoon. He continued antibiotics afterwards (prescribed 10 day course and was confirmed to have completed 7 days at follow up) with significant improvement.
LAB_DATA: CBC and blood culture done in hospital, not reported to PMD

SYMPTOM_TEXT: My son who received the immunizations complained about his leg hurting.  I assumed it was all typical pain but gave him some Tylenol to help with the pain. A little over 24 hours after receiving immunizations,  he was still complaining about pain, and I looked at his leg and realized he had a rash developing. We gave him benedryl and a bath. The next day it looked a little worse but that night it progressed to a raised, hot-to-the-touch rash that covered almost his entire front and side left thigh. We called the nurse who said to put ice on it and make an appointment the next day if it didn't get better. We went into the pediatrician's office the next day and  it had lessened a little in heat and color by that point. They said to keep an eye on it and make sure it didn't get any bigger. He's still complaining of pain, it's warm to the touch, and it's terribly frightening to look at. I'm very concerned and don't know what to think at this point.
OTHER_MEDS: 500 mg of Vitamin C and a gummy multi kids vitamin
CUR_ILL: Cough that's been around for a week or so but no fever or any other symptoms. He had an ear and eye infection March 11th  that was treated with antibiotics and eye drops.
HISTORY: He had his tonsils and adnoids removed in December of 2018 because he had enlarged adnoids and tonsils that were preventing liquid from draining after he got an ear infection and he was having difficulty hearing. He also has a history of loud snoring.

An unspecified number of improperly stored doses of VAQTA and PROQUAD were administered to unspecified patients on unspecified dates.; No adverse effect reported; This spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant and refers to an unspecified number of patients of unknown age and gender. No information was provided regarding the patients' medical history, concurrent conditions or concomitant medications. On an unknown date, the patients were vaccinated with an unspecified number of improperly stored doses of hepatitis a vaccine, inactivated (VAQTA) lot # R027431, expiration date 08-SEP-2019 for prophylaxis (dose and route of administration were not reported) and measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) lot # R021232, expiration date 21-JAN-2020 for prophylaxis (dose and route of administration were not reported) (product storage error). The sterile diluent (lot # and expiration date were not reported) that was used to reconstitute the measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) was stored properly. The administered dose of the vaccine hepatitis a vaccine, inactivated (VAQTA) experienced a temperature excursion above 9° C degrees Celsius (12.3C) for 5 hours and 21 minutes, as recorded by a data logger. The administered dose of the vaccine measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) experienced a temperature excursion above -9° C degrees Celsius to 8° C  (-2.4C) for 7 hours and 59 minutes, as recorded by a data logger. Patient got pale and started closing his eyes right after vaccines were finished being administered.  Patient seemed to be holding his breath during vaccine administration.  This RN encouraged patient to take some deep breaths while vaccines were being administered.  When patient got pale and started closing his eyes, patient's head was placed between knees.  Vitals were taken and were BP: 90/64; Resp:24; Pulse 74, Temp 98.6.  Pt  c/o of headache so 911 was called.  Paramedics arrived within 5 minutes.  EMS stated it was most likely a vaso-vagal response.  EMS gave the parent the option to go to ER to be evaluated.  Parent chose to have child transported to ER for further evaluation.

4yo male received PROQUAD and KINRIX in clinic at approx 16:40. At around 16:45, patient was noted to be anxious and started vomiting. Patient brought back to exam room at 16:55 when hives were noted on face. Vitals (BP 90/61, HR 165, SpO2 on room air 82%). Supplemental O2 started via mask-- >3L and SpO2 at 98%. Wheezing on exam in mid lung fields Hives on face and arms Epinephrine 0.15 mg IM and Benadryl 20 mg IM administered at 17:06 and patient transported to ED via EMS at 17:20. In ED patient was given prednisoLONE 15 mg/5 mL oral syrup (Order): 21 mg, PO, ONE TIME and Pepcid pediatric (Order): 11 mg, IVPush, ONE TIME. Admitted overnight to general pediatric floor for observation and had no recurrence of symptoms. Discharged 4/25/2019.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: After the visit as pt. Was checking out she became dizzy and pale in color.  I had mom bring pt. Back to a room and we layed her flat on her back with knees bent and gave OJ.  Pt. Refused to drink the OJ, so I gave her a bottle of water.   She sipped that.  Within a few minutes the color came back into her lips and she was feeling better, playing on mom's phone.  Dr. assessed her and d/c her.

I am a medical physician, Radiation oncologist, mother of 6 (all five before completely vaacinated).  I never thought twice about any harmful effects of vaacines and as a MD, naturally vaacinated my baby according to schedule.  He was bright, happy, talkative with constant babbling, engaging with older siblings, etc.  Immediately after the vaacine (Dtap and MMR) he was fussy and withdrawn.  I figured that might be normal for a few hours or a day but it got worse.  NO LANGUAGE OR BABBLING WHATSOEVER.  It was literally like our little boy was just gone...like he was just a shell.  No interaction, eye contact, developmental milestones, personality...nothing!  He had fevers and they resolved after several days but he remained withdrawn for 3 weeks.  Then I researched this situation and provided extra vitamins in his formula (who knows if that had any impact) but he began, as if developing from the beginning, from scratch, to slowly reengage for periods of time.  Like we would all get short glimpses of the child we knew.  Then more and more, he just seemed to recover and now he is meeting all neurologic/developmental milestones and seems at 21 months to be "normal."  I finally have the time and felt compelled to add this to your data base all this time later.  It was so scary and really devastating and fortunately short lived.  I will not vaacinate him any further.  The risk far outweighs the potential benefit in this sweet baby boy!  As a medical licensed, practicing full time physican, mother of 5 other vaacinated children, non-conspirist type person, and medical director of the Care Center,  I feel very strongly that I am qualified to say and a reliable testimony to say that this reaction was absolutely the cause of something in one of those vaacines.   As a parent it was terrifying and profound.  I have no idea why he recovered his functioning but our family is so thankful he did.  It may be helpful to know that he was delivered by C-section because of a fibroid I had (nothing developmentally wrong with him), 3 weeks early.   Also two of my kids are my step kids and it may be helpful to know that one of them (the boy, now 17 years old) has high functioning autism.  I don't know if either of these factors predisposed patient to these reactions or not.  I received no vaacinations whatsoever during pregnancy.
LAB_DATA: He had what appeared to our nanny to be a seizure and was especially withdrawn one day...his eyes rolled back and forth and he was flushed.  We rushed him to Hospital ER and he was examined.  His vitals were stable and he was given f/u as outpatient.  By then he had recovered and we just didn't want to put him through a blood draw when there was likely no answer or help.  We also had speech therapy get involved to help with some swallowing difficulties that resulted and again these resolved w/in a month. Also I'm not sure if he had an adverse reaction to the vaacines given in the first week of life since I'm not sure how you would know or tell.  Also I'm not totally sure of the type of vaacine, only that it was the 4 month old MMR and Dtap.  These were given at the Pediatric Clinic under Dr. who is now retired so they would have the record of the precise vaacines given.

This child was getting his shots as part of a catch-up series.  Two injections were given in each leg by two practitioners, doing them simultaneously for the first pair and simultaneously for the second pair of vaccines.  Between the first and second vaccine, the child began to fuss and his arm got loose.  After the vaccines were over and as one practitioner was leaving the room, that practitioner noticed own left hand bleeding from a scrape approx. 3 inches long.  We are not sure but it seems a vaccine needle caused the scrape to the practitioner which was not felt or noticed during vaccination.  No injury to the patient.
LAB_DATA: This case has been discussed with appropriate infectious disease consultant.  The child's mother has been advised and appropriate testing of the practitioner is underway.  Risk of any transmission of any infection to the child or practitioner is extremely low.
SYMPTOM1: Circumstance or information capable of leading to medication error

SYMPTOM_TEXT: APPROXIMATELY 30 MINUTES FROM VACCINE INJECTION  MOM RETURNED WITH PATIENT HAVING HIVES, REDNESS OF FACE AND UPPER BODY AND INCREASED WORK OF BREATHING .  PULSE OX 95%  BEFORE GIVING (1MG/ML) EPINEPHRINE GIVEN 0.15 IM LEFT THIGH - AND SINGLE  (COMBINATION OF ALBUTEROL / IPATROPIUM) BREATHING TREATMENT.  REDNESS GREATLY IMPROVED , PULSE OX INCREASED TO 98%  ON  ROOM AIR  SCHEDULED FOLLOW UP TOMORROW

about 1 hr after vaccines patient returned to office with significant urticarial rash to body, including surrounding lips. No tongue swelling. No advers effect reported; either administered a third dose of M-M-R II or a dose of Proquad at over 12 years of age; either administered a third dose of M-M-R II or a dose of Proquad at over 12 years of age; This spontaneous report was received from healthcare professional and refers to a patient of unknown age (reported by the medical assistant as of being currently "college age"). On 30-APR-2013, the patient received a dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live(M-M-R II) subcutaneously (strength, dose, lot # and expiration date not reported) and a dose of varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX). Later, on 30-MAY-2013, the patient received a second dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live(M-M-R II) subcutaneously (strength, dose, lot # and expiration date not reported) and a second dose of varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX). The medical assistant stated that for college entry, on 30-MAY-2018, the patient received either a third dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live(M-M-R II) subcutaneously (strength, dose, lot # and expiration date not reported) or a dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live(PROQUAD) subctuaneously (strength, dose, lot # and expiration date not reported). Merck Sterile diluent was used as diluent for the administered vaccines. All vaccines were administered for prophylaxis. No adverse effects were reported.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Lethargic, staring away and not looking at us, extended stare and dazed.  Then extremely fussy, crying hard.  Developed rash and spiked a fever over 105 degrees.  Diarrhea. And sick overall.  Had to rush to the ER as she wouldn't look at us and spiked a fever over 105.  Months to follow initial reaction, continued to get sick with respiratory infections and more
LAB_DATA: Had to rush to the ER as she wouldn't look at us and spiked a fever over 105.
HISTORY: Sick too often, respiratory infections, fevers, coughs, developed pneumonia a couple months later and continuing to get sick more often than many others.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: red/painful at the injection sights.  Within 24 hours, her body from head to toe broke out in a measles like rash and she started having a fever of 103.  I took her to the hospital and she was given an iv with .9 saline.  Discharged home.  The next day, I took her to the doctor office.  Dr said it looked like hives and sent her to the emergency room.  ER gave her an antihistamine and more IV fluids.  Sent her home.  The day following, I took her back to the doctor's office.  They sent her to the ER again.  This time, they gave her steroids and fluids IV.  They couldn't determine if it was measles or not, so they sent her to another hospital via ambulance.   She was admitted to the pediatric unit and put in quarantine.  They wanted an infectious control doctor to rule out measles.   She received a lot of steroids and was on an IV for days.  They documented that she did not have an outbreak of measles but that she had a "virus" prior to receiving the MMR and it caused a rash resembling measles.  Staff still continued to gown up to enter the room she was in.

First vaccine given for this 11 year old patient on 4/19/19. No previous Hx of any vaccinations. On 4/28/19 he developed a fever Tmax 103 degrees F. On 4/29/19 he was evaluated at an urgent care facility, negative for strep, flu, mono. Negative chest xray. Had low WBC count. He was seen at PCP office on 4/30/19 after developing a diffuse rash over chest/back/trunk/face/neck/hairline, with fever of 102 degrees F. He also had candidiasis of mouth. He was treated for thrush, physician consulted with peds infectious disease physician and suspected vaccine reaction to MMRV.
CUR_ILL: mild intermittent asthma with symptom of tight chest on 4/22/19

SYMPTOM_TEXT: multiple unspecified patients were administered a dose of improperly stored PROQUAD and VARIVAX; No adverse effects were reported.; This non-valid spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant referring to unspecified patients of unknown age and gender. There was no information about the patient's concurrent conditions, allergies, concomitant therapies or medical history.   On multiple unspecified dates, multiple unspecified patients were administered a dose of improperly stored Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) rHA for prophylaxis (Lot number R015738 with expiration date on 12-FEB-2019, dose, route of administration were not reported) or varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck) (VARIVAX) ) for prophylaxis (Lot number R018780 with expiration date on 01-JUL-2020, dose, route of administration were not reported).  The administered dose of the vaccines experienced a temperature excursion in the range of 15 F to 46 F of 15.1 F for 1 hour and 20 minutes, as recorded by a data logger. The vaccines had not had any previous temperature excursions. There were no adverse effects reported. Furthermore, no product quality complaint was involved.

Child received vaccines around 1030 AM. Mom took the child to grandmother's house around 12:00 and he looked normal at that time. Mom picked the child up around 4:00 pm and she noticed swelling underneath his chin, redness to raised area, and a red rash on right cheek. Back with a little rash that appears the same as chin and cheek rash. Mom called triage who advised her to take the child to the ER. Mom presented to the urgent care within the same facility as writer's office. Urgent care sent child to be seen in the pediatric department. Writer promptly evaluated child. Child was happy, sitting on the exam table. Firm swollen mass under chin not extending completely to neck. Right cheek and upper back appeared red. No hives. Breathing appeared normal without distress or stridor. Oxygen level was 97% in office. Excessive drooling was noticed, mom reports that this is unusual for him. Child was sent to the emergency room for further evaluation via private vehicle.
There was a large amount of redness to the site of injection one week after the injection

4 Y female Complex medical h/o with neonatal lung disease, pulmonary hypertension; s/p R AKA after (chart notes indicate) complications following cardiac cath, called after possible anaphylactic reaction on 1/18/2019 resulting in ED visit. On 1/18/19, received two vaccines - DTaP-POL and MMR-VAR; has received similar in past with no problems.  Bandaid was applied.  No obvious latex exposure such as latex tourniquet or gloves / no blood draw that day. No new foods that day.  She was still taking amoxicillin, took a dose around 9:30 AM.  She took more doses after that with no subsequent reactions. Symptoms started as walking out of clinic.   Initially, had ?aspiration-- coughing, shortness of breath, and turned "purple" ; received breathing treatment. O2 sat noted to be 84%. Later, she started turning red.  No individual hives, no lip/eyelid swelling. No vomiting.  +respiratory distress initially as noted and seemed to improve after epi / benadryl in ED.  Overall 2 hours to improvement." Further history is that she had a mild reaction with perioral hives after eating jello as a 1 year old, and the family has been avoiding any jello/gelatin in her diet since that time. Current Treatment:  EPi / benadryl for anaphylaxis action plan Note:Anaphylaxis after MMR-VAR (and DTAP-POL although MMR-VAR was the likely cause).  Skin test positive for the vaccine and for gelatin.  Gelatin is most common cause of MMR-VAR allergy.  Vaccines known to contain gelatin include: MMR, varicella, Japanese encephalitis virus, yellow fever, zoster.  She needs allergy evaluation before any of those vaccines or DTAP-POL.
HISTORY: ex 24 week preemie, Neonatal lung disease, pulmonary hypertension, Above knee amputation 3/2017, Asthma, Acq renal cys
ALLERGIES: Avocado, Gelatin (jello perioral hives at 1 yr age)

SYMPTOM_TEXT: This 57 year old woman was given an MMRV instead of MMR and was taking ASA at the time.  The error was not found until she called asking questions about the number of vaccines she received versus what her husband received. It was discovered at that time, that she received the wrong vaccine.  She was advised to call her primary doctor to see if she should stop her ASA for the next 5 days.  She was rightfully upset about not being notified.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: 3 dimensional hives all over her cheeks / had breakouts o hives intermittently over 4 days; the patient received a dose of PROQUAD instead of MMR II; This spontaneous report was received from a consumer (the patient's mother) and refers to a 5.5 years old female patient. The patient had no concomitant medications, pertinent medical history and no drug reactions or allergies. She was vaccinated with 2 doses of varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck) (VARIVAX) when she was supposed to have them (at 1-year-old).  On an unknown date, the patient was vaccinated with the first dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live (M-M-R II) injection (exact dose, route of administration, albumin status, vaccination site, lot # and expiry date were not specified) for prophylaxis. On 01-MAY-2019, at the doctor's office, the patient was supposed to receive the second dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live (M-M-R II) due to measles outbreak, however she received a dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) injection (exact dose, route of administration, albumin status, vaccination site, lot # and expiry date were not reported) instead.  On 02-MAY-2019, the patient was seen in the physician's office due to 3 dimensional hives all over her cheeks. The consumer reported that the patient had breakouts of hives intermittently over 4 days. No lab diagnostics or studies were performed. The patient received an unspecified treatment due to the event. Product quality complaint (PQC) was not involved.  The outcome of urticaria was reported as recovered/resolved on approximately 06-MAY-2019. The relatedness between the event and the suspect vaccines was not provided.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: the patient developed a localized rash with no bumps at an unspecified location; the patient also developed a fever that reached up to 103.9F; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse practitioner via a company representative, concerning to her daughter, a 12 month old female patient. The patient had not pertinent medical history, concomitant medications, drug reactions or allergies. Information regarding the patient's pertinent concurrent conditions was not provided.  On 03-MAY-2019, the patient was vaccinated with a dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) lot # R026362, expiration date reported as 31-MAR-2020, but upon internal review validation established as 15-MAR-2020, subcutaneously (strength and anatomical location were not provided) for prophylaxis. On 10-MAY-2019, the patient experienced a localized rash with no bumps at an unspecified location and also a fever that reached up to 103.9 fahrenheit (pyrexia). On 12-MAY-2019, reported as two days later, the patient recovered from the event pyrexia. It was reported that no medical attention was sought for the events and no laboratory diagnostic studies were performed. It was unknown whether the patient received treatment for the events.   The outcome of rash was reported as resolved on an unknown date in May 2019. The causality between the events and therapy with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) was unknown.

Patient presented at the Emergency room on 5/7/2019 at 13:47 for complaints of right shoulder and arm discomfort, Right cheek and right ear warm to touch and red.  Fever of 100.7 at home.  Per mother patient is subdued and more lethargic.   Eating and drinking normally.   Motrin Ranitidine, Benadryl given at 16:19 in the ER.   05/09/2019 Mother took patient back to the ER with concerns of redness on right arm.  Diagnosed with Cellulitis.  Keflex , tylenol, ibuprofen and benadryl give.
OTHER_MEDS: No known medication were being taken at time of vaccination
HISTORY: Per parent report patient is on the autism spectrum.
ALLERGIES: No known allergies to medications, food or other products.

Improperly stored proquad or varivax; This spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant refers to multiple unspecified patients of unknown age and gender. The patients medical history, concurrent conditions, drug allergies and concomitant medications were not reported. On multiple unspecified dates, the patients were vaccinated with a dose of improperly stored varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # R010468, expiry date 10-APR-2020, R017641, expiry date 20-JUN-2020, R010466, expiry date 10-APR-2020) or measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live(PROQUAD) (lot# R020814, expiry date 16-JAN-2020, R015738 expiry date 02-DEC-2019) which was reconstituted with properly stored sterile diluent. Temperature: Total time in the range 6 degree Fahrenheit to 14 degree Fahrenheit (8.8 Fahrenheit), time frame: 24 minutes. Previous temperature excursion : total time in the range 6 degree Fahrenheit to 14 degree Fahrenheit (5.9 fahrenheit) for 12 minutes, total time in range 6 degree Fahrenheit to 14 degree Fahrenheit (5.5 fahrenheit) for 6 minutes recommended frozen range minus 58 degree fahenheit to 5 degree Fahrenheit (5.1 fahrenheit) for 6 minutes total time in range 6 degree Fahrenheit to 14 degree Fahrenheit (5.5F)for 12minutes. Data logger was involved.

Patient fainted after receiving vaccines. He was treated immediately with placing in position to increase blood flow to head and given Apple juice to drink. Ice pack applied to bump on forehead.  Patient recovered quickly and was stable, ok to go home after approximately 15 minutes.

Patient received MMRV as well as Varicella- so 2 doses of Varicella received on 5/21/19. Patients Mother notified that evening and currently no adverse reactions seen in patient. Per IIS  ? Immunization Information System on call epidemiologist to watch for an increased localized reaction, Patients mother aware to watch for any reaction and to call with questions or concerns.
OTHER_MEDS: Amoxicillin 250mg/5ml give 6ml by mouth every 12 hours for 10 days. Start date5/13/19
CUR_ILL: Conjunctivitis of both eyes, Right ear infection on 5/13/19 Viral URI 5/3/19

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Pt received MMRV vaccine in his Lt thigh on the 14th of May 2019. MOP reported the Pt's Lt thigh had redness in the size of a quarter on the 16th of May, the area was warm to the touch with small red bums in the area. Pt reported itchiness. No fever or pain.. Pt was seen on the 16th by his PCM and was treated with Benadryl and Steroids.  Pt followed up with PCM on the 17th of May and the redness, itchiness, and warmth  decreased.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: No adverse effects reported; one dose of an improperly stored vaccine was administered to one patient; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse and refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. There was no information about the patients' concurrent conditions or medical histories provided. On 02-MAY-2019, the patient was vaccinated with one dose of an improperly stored measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) 0.5 milliliter, subcutaneously, lot # R017799 with expiration date on 19-DEC-2019 (frequency was not reported) for prophylaxis. Concomitant therapies included sterile diluent (Merck Sharp & Dohme). The vaccine underwent temperature excursion of 12.7 degrees Fahrenheit for 50 minutes. There was previous temperature excursion of 6.8 degrees Fahrenheit for 20 minutes on 01-MAY-2019. The digital data logger was involved in recording excursion details. Sterile diluent was stored in the correct temperature storage range. No adverse effects were reported.  This is one of three reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1905USA007760: US-009507513-1905USA010266:

Hard, tender lump, joint pain, pain in hands, pain with walking, high fever, body aches, nauseous, dizzy, fainting. I developed cellulitis after being told to simply hot pack it when I called into the doctors office. I then went to urgent care the next day.  I wish I was hospitalized. I have never been so sick in my life.
LAB_DATA: Went to urgent care and was told by the nurse and the doctor the shot I was given was administered wrong.
OTHER_MEDS: Benadryl (to help sleep), biotin, melatonin, atorvastatin,  dukoxetine

SYMPTOM_TEXT: I saw patient today, not quite 48 hours after his four year vaccines, given as two injections to the left leg (MMRV and DTAP-IPV).  Yesterday he got a swollen right thigh at vaccine site and developed fever to 102.8. He was shaking at the time of fever and--with his seizure history-- parents wondered if could have been seizure (vs shaking with fever). Parents gave him Benadryl and took him to Urgent Care, where he was deemed to be having a vaccine reaction. He has not been walking well, and parents noted some puffiness around his eyes, so they brought him into the office today. He was febrile in the office and was walking holding onto dad's hand, gingerly, not wanting to bear weight on sore leg. There is tenderness, calor and splotchy erythema at his leg, but parents reports I am seeing it the way it looks improved after Benadryl.  No breathing problems/clear chest on exam. Mild periorbital edema bilaterally. No hip, knee or ankle pain. The area does not look like infection/cellulitis at this point, and--especially with the way it responds to Benadryl-- I feel his is a vaccine reaction. I have advised continuing Motrin q 6 hrs and Benadryl q 6 hrs and returning should fever persist in the next one to two days or should pain or symptoms worsen or continue.
LAB_DATA: CBC done in office, largerly unremarkable with WBC 11, 400 (84n)
OTHER_MEDS: None until his leg started hurting and swelling-- now family is managing with Benadryl and Motrin
HISTORY: 4 yr M with hx benign neonatal familial convulsions, weaned off phenobarbital after 12 months. His older brother had a stroke in 2017, and patient himself had some facial twisting episodes afterwards also. After full evaluation, he was found to have Chiari 1 malformation and congenital hypoplasia of depressor angularis oris muscle. He is followed by Neuro and Neurosurgery

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Within 6 hours of the injection, he developed a fever lasting several days.  Wednesday/day of injection: patient developed a fever ranging from 101.6 - 102.  He was very tired and felt unwell.  He developed a cough.  He also vomited twice and experienced diarrhea.,  Thursday/day after injection: Fevers of 101.3 persisted throughout the day.  He still felt unwell and still had a cough. He also vomited twice and experienced diarrhea. Friday/2 days after the injection: Fevers of 102.4 persisted throughout the day.  He still felt unwell and still had a cough.  Saturday/3 days after the injection: He experienced fevers although I did not document the exact temperature.  He still had a cough and felt unwell.  His fever persisted unbroken from Wednesday - Saturday.  He also experienced chills on and off the entire time.  Sunday he woke up with no fever, and feeling well.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: No adverse effects; improperly stored dose administered; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse and refers to a patient of unknown age and gender. 5/28/19 Immunizations given 5/29/19 Per mom child woke up with red, hot spot on left leg that was hot to touch and approximately 2 inches by 2 inches in diameter. 5/30/19 Per mom redness had gotten larger and opened and was draining yellow fluid and was crusty; size was approximately 4 or 5 inches in the center with about 1 inch open. Child was taken to a provider and diagnosed with cellulitis and placed on antibiotics.  6/4/19 Per mom open area is scabbed over, red size about 2 inches in diameter.
PRIOR_VAX: Immunizations given this date in affected leg were Prevnar 13 and Varivax.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: I gave the Proquad ( MMR- Varicells) and the Varicella to patient on the same day.
Large widespread hives, many over 12"in diameter. Even with Benadryl, lasted days.
Fever and vomiting within 24 hours. By day 5 post-vaccination fever and vomiting have resolved but decreased appetite has persisted.
HISTORY: Iron-deficient anemia and borderline high lead (5 mcg/dl, pending venous repeat)
ALLERGIES: No known food or drug allergies.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Patient began with inflammation and pain at injection site.  By 8:00 PM that same evening inflamed area was erythematous and measured approximatel 5 cm in diamete in an uneven roughly oval shape.  Patient was brought back into the office on 06/06/2019 at 1:15 PM for evaluation.  Inflamed area now measured approximately 12.5 cm erythematous, pruritic, and painful.  Patient diagnosed with cellulitis, placed on augmentin 400mg-57 mg/5 ml  with order of 5 ml twice daily via oral route x 10 days, prednisolone 15 mg/ 5 ml with order of 5 ml twice daily via oral rout x 5 days.  Will re-evaluate in office in 5 days or earlier as needed.
ALLERGIES: NKDA. No known allergies to foods or environmental sources.

4x3 cm left delta ... Mother states that patient complained once or twice about the pain after administration. Swelling and pain started one day after administration. Mother gave patient ibuprofen for pain, which helped, and applied Neosporin to the area of concern. Mother states that patient possibly scratched the area of administration as it caused redness, which is why Neosporin was applied, and a scab formed. Swelling and pain was gone after 2-3 days of administration. During that time, area was sensitive to touch and there was a possible bruise?

red rash and swelling around injection site; Rash around vaccine site; red rash and swelling around injection site; provider suggested cold compress and OTC benadryl for itching; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse practitioner and refers to a 4-year-old female patient. Concurrent condition included constipation. The patient was not ill at time of vaccination. Concomitant medication included polyethylene glycol 3350 (MIRALAX). There was no information about the patient's medical history.  On 09-APR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with a first dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live rHA (recombinant human albumin) (PROQUAD) subcutaneously in the right thigh for vaccination (lot no. R021101 has been verified to be a valid lot number for measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live rHA (recombinant human albumin) (PROQUAD), expiration date not reported, but upon internal validation established as 20-JAN-2020) (formulation and dose  were not reported). Other suspect vaccine received on the same date included diphtheria toxoid, pertussis acellular 1-component vaccine, poliovirus vaccine inactivated (vero), tetanus toxoid (DTAP-IPV) intramuscularly in the left thigh (formulation, dose and indication were not reported).  On 11-APR-2019, the patient experienced red rash and swelling around injection site, provider suggested cold compress and over the counter (OTC) diphenhydramine (BENADRYL) for itching and to return to clinic for evaluation if no improvement. The patient did not received any prescription drug treatment for the events. On 13-APR-2019, the patient was in office and swelling, rash at injection site resolved. The outcome of red rash and itching and was not reported. The causality assessment  was not provided.  This is one of two reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1906USA002505:

On 6/6/2019 I administered Proquad which is MMR and varicella combined and a varicella. I was supposed to administer MMR and varicella separately. Mother was notified immediately and so were the nurses, I spoke to the provider and he stated the patient would be fine. I also contacted Merck to double check the patient would not be at risk.
I started getting a rash all over my body - little red itchy bumps that itch like crazy. So far has only grown worse. Treating with Benadryl and hydrocortisone cream.

The patient was administered one dose of improperly stored Proquad; No adverse effects were reported; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse, referring to a patient of unknown age and gender. The patient's relevant medical history, previous allergies or drug reactions, concomitant medications and concurrent conditions were not disclosed.  On 30-JAN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with a dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (strength, frequency, anatomical injection site and route of administration were not disclosed) for prophylaxis; lot # R015740 and expiration date  reported as 03-DEC-2019, but upon internal validation established as 02-DEC-2019.  It was reported that this vaccine had been on a temperature excursion and was stored at 21 °F during 19 hours; and it was also noted that there had been a previous temperature excursion of 96 hours at a temperature of 14 °F (6 °F - 14 °F).  At the time of this report, there were no adverse events reported. Digital data logger was involved.

Patients were vaccinated with improperly stored vaccines; no adverse symptom; This non-valid spontaneous report was received from a medical assistant concerning an unspecified number of patient of unknown age and gender. The patient's concurrent conditions and medical history, as well as concomitant medications, were not reported.  On an unknown date, the patients were vaccinated with improperly stored doses of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (lot # R012416, expiration date 28-OCT-2019) and varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck) (VARIVAX) (lot# N031003, expiration date 03-NOV-2019) (strengths, doses, frequencies and anatomical sites were unknown) all for prophylaxis, which had a temperature excursion on the range of 15°F to 46°F (21.6°F) for 12.5 hours. The temperature excursion was detected by a data logger and no adverse symptoms were reported.

No adverse effect reported; patient were each administered an improperly stored dose of VARIVAX; This spontaneous report was received from a nurse referring to two unspecified patients of unknown ages and unknown genders. Information of concurrent condition, medical history and concomitant therapy were not provided.    On 24-OCT-2018, patients were vaccinated with varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck) (VARIVAX) lot#R017635 with expiration date 20-JUN-2020 (strength, dose and route were not reported) for prophylaxis and sterile diluent (STERILE DILUENT). The varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX) vaccines experienced temperature excursion and were stored at 6 to 14 Fahrenheit degrees (9.1 Fahrenheit degrees ) for 50 minutes (Product storage error). There was no previous temperature excursion. No adverse events were reported in any patients. A data logger was involved. The outcome of the event was not reported.  Follow-up information was received from the reporting nurse on 05-JUN-2019.  The nurse reported the patient's demographics and were updated in the case.  It was also reported that on 24-OCT-2018, the patient was vaccinated with Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) for prophylaxis, lot # R011802, expiration date 21-OCT-2019 (strength, dose, frequency, route of administration and anatomical site of injection were not reported).  This is one of three reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1906USA002234: US-009507513-1810USA011328:

at 830 PM on 05/30/2019 child had prolonged complex febrile seizure with status epilepticus, requiring Ativan, Intubation at uRGENT care.  Transferred by helicopter to Hospital.  Extubated 6/2/19, room air 6/3/2019, discharged home 06/06/2019, Sepsis work up done including LP,Blood Culture, MRI, EEG, all negatives, IV antibiotics given for presumed aspiration pneumonia until cultures negative.  Etiology of prolonged complex febrile seizure, status epilepticus, encephalopathy, hypoventilation, unknown.  childs temp was 102.6, no previous, fever, no family history of febrile seizures, Child seen today, and PE is completely normal
CUR_ILL: 4/22/19 conjunctivitis, pre op Physical before PE tubes

patient received doses of ProQuad and Varivax on the same day; both vaccines administered "intramuscular"; This spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse referring to a 12 month old male patient. The patient's pertinent medical history, concurrent conditions, drug reactions/allergies and concomitant medications were not provided.     On 23-MAY-2019, around 11:45, the patient received 0.5 ml doses of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) lot # S000620, expiry date on 06-JUL-2020, therapy type rHA and varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck) (VARIVAX) lot #R010469, expiry date on 10-APR-2020; both by intramuscular route, for prophylaxis and reconstituted with sterile diluent (STERILE DILUENT).   The nurse realize that both vaccines were administered on the same day until the end of the day, they had not reached out to the mother and the mother had not called to report any adverse event.  As of reporting date, it was unknown if the patient was experiencing any adverse event from receiving measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) and varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck) (VARIVAX) at 12 months old.

Mom states that patient developed a lump and a bruise in his left thigh at the MMRV injection site shortly after vaccination.  The lump and bruise were present for 1 month before the bruise resolved, but the lump remained. Last week, the area turned red and a scab appeared. Patient was seen in our office today by DR, diagnosed with an abscess and is being treated with a topical OTC antibiotic.
HISTORY: mom states that patient experiencing "growing pains" about once a month, wakes up crying at night with leg pains

After receiving vaccines, patient appeared pale and lost consciousness for about 3 seconds. Patient was laid back on exam table. Patient became responsive and alert and oriented. Vitals were obtained, BP 108/71, HR 98. Cold compress was applied. Patient was given juice and lollipop. Patient was monitored for additional 25 minutes. Vitals were rechecked, BP 108/74, HR 84. Her color returned to normal and she stated she felt better. Patient left office with mom in stable condition.

Pt developed facial rash on 6/2/19.  Was seen in ER on 6/3/19 and diagnosed with questionable varicella.  On 6/6/19 she was seen in clinic and case was discussed with infectious disease and they suspected attenuate form of measles secondary to recent vaccination.  Varicella Igm, Measles Igm, and Rubeola Ab was drawn.  Measles and varicella were negative, but measles nasal swab was positive.  Pt currently has DNA typing pending.
LAB_DATA: 6/6/19-Varicella Igm, Measles Igm and Rubeola Ab.  DNA typing is pending.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: No symptoms after the mmr shot. After 6 days my son started a fever. We gave him Tylenol at 7 pm and he went to sleep. At 2 am he woke up screaming. His face was red and he was extremely hot to touch. I took him to the ER right away. We were there from 2 am - 5 am. His temp was 103.2 they gave him Motrin and his fever went down and we were discharged after 3 hours. While there they tested patient for RSV, influenza, and an ear infection which all came back negative. Less than 24 hours later he has a fever of 104.8 and hot to touch. We are not happy about this mmr vaccine.

Patient came in for R arm being completely swollen and warm to the touch.  Patient stated the swelling began the night of the administration and continued to swell. Patient was not complaining of any pain or loss of movement. No fever. He is otherwise well.
LAB_DATA: Both arms were measured for the radius which showed that the right arm was 22.75cm in width compared to the non effected left arm of 18 cm.  Recommended that the patients mother continues to monitor the arm and ice it to assist with swelling and to follow up on 20 Jun 19.

LAB_DATA: Lead tests were done and showed high levels!
HISTORY: Stopped talking/making noises,  regression in eye contact, couldn't imitate sounds or movement, and developed Apraxia.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: pt was receiving 3 vaccines at well child visit. Pt was given 2 doses of MMRV (Proquad) at visit. MA gave Kinrix to Right Thigh IM, followed by Proquad to Right thigh IM accidentally instead of Havrix Hep A, patient then kicked next (3rd) syringe (Havrix) out of MA hand removing the needle and causing a waste of vaccine. MA asked LVN to draw up Proquad  and confirmed the need for Proquad, LVN then drew up and gave injection while MA held patient for injection. after leaving the room MA realized mistake and advised LVN/Clinical Supervisor that patient had been given 2 proquads by accident. mother of child was asked to return to office within 30 minutes of realization. patients provider was notified followed by Clinic manager, She contacted Health department and Merck to report incident, Poison control was contacted. and pt was observed in office by both provider and clinic supervisor. pt not having any adverse reactions at that time. mother was given ER precautions and adverse reactions to watch for. pt will return to office in the morning for follow up. pt will return to office at a later date to receive Havrix Hep A that she did not receive at this visit. Mother voiced understanding to all instructions given.

Patient received the MMR(V) Vaccine at her 12-month checkup. 3 days after, she was crying and screaming and seemed to be in pain. She was inconsolable. The following morning, patient woke up and was acting sluggish and confused. Around 1:30 p.m. patient went into a seizure and her eyes were staring off. Upon arriving at in the Emergency Room, she was rushed back and Respiratory was rushed in. She was put on Oxygen for about 30 minutes before she opened her eyes. We were transported to another Hospital for an overnight observation.
LAB_DATA: The Medical Team lied and kept telling us this must have been a fever. They said she had Para-Influenza. There is a full list of Resuscitation that were given to patient. We were not given that info but I did take a photo of that paper. I knew they wouldn't want to release that.

It was reported that the patients received improperly stored vaccines (product storage error). The temperature excursion for the vaccines was reported as 6.4 degree Fahrenheit for 60 minute, 7.7 degree Fahrenheit for 60 minutes and 7.0 degree Fahrenheit for 60 minutes. There were no previous temperature excursions. Digital data logger was involved. No product quality complaint was involved. The outcome of product storage error was unknown.  Lot No. R024144 has been verified to be a valid lot number for [varicella virus vaccine live], expiration date reported as 30-AUG-2020, but upon internal validation established as 23-AUG-2020.  Lot No. R018778 has been verified to be a valid lot number for [measles, mumps, rubella and varicella], expiration date reported as 18-DEC-2019, but upon internal validation established as 29-DEC-2019.  This case was considered as non-valid due to lack of patient identifiers.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Grandmother left voice mail on 6/19/19 to report episodes of diarrhea alternating with formed stool on 6/9/19, day two post vaccination, followed by a rash on 6/19/19 day 12 post vaccination. Child had  poor appetite and low energy, though continued to eat and drink. Temporal temps read 99 F. A once daily dose of Tylenol was given next 4-5 days to treat.  On 6/19/19  a mild rash was noted over his back and neck. This lasted for about 2 days, spread to the chest and toward his face. Benadryl was given once daily. Child did not complain of itching. Once the rash erupted, the child's energy returned to normal, as well as his appetite. The rash faded within two days. The nurse was able to reach the grandmother for details on Monday June 24 2019. At that time the child was fully back to normal.
ALLERGIES: none; past history of sensitivity to powdered infant formula

SYMPTOM_TEXT: 6/25/19 - 2:30pm: patient received vaccinations in office. 6/25/19 - 3:30pm: Mom called stating patient crying and saying that his belly hurt.  was instructed to monitor for rash/hives, any wheezing or difficulty breathing. 6/25/19 - 4:13pm: Mom called back stating that patient now with hives in his groin and c/o difficulty breathing, they were already in the car heading to our office or ER.  Per Dr. family was advised to go straight to nearest ER, they were 5-10mins from Hospital. 6/25/19 - 4:56pm: Triage nurse called mom to f/u.  Pt was in ED, IV was placed and getting ready to receive Benadryl.  Breathing issue had calmed down at this point.  Mom not sure of exact ER plan at this time. 6/26/19 - 9:23am: Triage nurse called mom to f/u.  Per mom patient was doing better this morning.  Was told that he had some type of allergic reaction to one of the immunizations but unable to pinpoint which one.  In ED was given IV Benadryl, Prevacid and a steroid.  Prescribed Prednisone for 5 days.  Per Dr. was instructed to take either Zyrtec or Benadryl today.  Take the steroids for 3 days, and do the full 5 day course of the steroid if any symptoms recur.  Instructed to f/u with allergist, allergy number given.
OTHER_MEDS: Received a dose of Motrin at home prior to coming in the office for the appt.
CUR_ILL: Seen in the office on 6/17/19 for an itchy rash on legs, arms and face for a few days.  Diagnosed with Rhus dermatitis and instructed to use hydrocortisone cream 2-3 times per day to itchy skin avoiding eyes.  to use Zyrtec for itching.  was instructed to call back if worsened/not improving.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Full body rash that itches. We were told by the doctor?s office to stay home until rash goes away.

patient's titer for Varicella was negative; patient complained of pain at the injection site, on the left arm, after receiving M-M-R II; inadvertently received M-M-R II instead of Proquad; ptient received proquad on 07-DEC-2017; This spontaneous report was received from a Certified Medical Assistant and was refering to a 15 year old female patient. The patient's pertinent medical history included anxiety, depression, insomnia and migraines. The patient's concurrent conditions was not reported. The patient had no drug reactions or allergies.   On 07-DEC-2017, the patient was vaccinated with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live(PROQUAD), (strength, dose number, frequency, route and anatomical location were not reported), lot number M048201, expiration date 05-JUN-2016 (reported as "05-JUN-2018"), as required immunization (Product administered to patient of inappropriate age).    On a n unknown date (reported as "on a recent unspecified date"), the patient's titers for varicella resulted as negative, showed no immunity (antibody test negative). Then, on 29-MAY-2019, the patient presented to the physician's office to obtain required immunizations, that had not be completed at that time. Then, on that date, the patient was inadvertently vaccinated with measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live(M-M-R II), lot # R029513, expiration date 14-OCT-2020, 0.5 milliliter, once, subcutaneous in the left arm, diluted with sterile diluent, lot number R002518, expiration date 12-DEC-2019, as required immunization, instead of the required Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live(PROQUAD) (interchange of vaccine products). On the same date, the patient complained of pain at the injection site on the left arm.      On 31-MAY-2019, the patient was seen on the physician's office and the pain at the injection site was resolved. The patient did not received any treatment for the injection site pain.   At the time of reporting, the outcome of antibody test negative was unknown. The reporter did not assessed the causal relationship between the suspect therapies and all of the events.
HISTORY: Medical History/Concurrent Conditions: Anxiety; Depression; Insomnia; Migraine
SYMPTOM4: Product administered to patient of inappropriate age

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Wrong vaccine administered; No adverse effect; This spontaneous report was received from a administrator concerning to a 12 month old patient. Information regarding the patient's medical history, concurrent conditions and allergies was not reported.  On an unknown date, the patient was vaccinated with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) lot # S003086 has been verified to be a valid lot number for measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live expiration date reported as 29-JUL-2020 and upon internal validation established as 29-JUL-2020, in the left arm, for prophylaxis (strength, dose and route of administration were not reported). And in the right arm the patient was vaccinates with varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX) lot # R027995 has been verified to be a valid lot number for varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)expiration date reported as 01-OCT-2020 and upon internal validation established as 01-OCT-2020, in the left arm, for prophylaxis (strength, dose and route of administration were not reported). Administrator reported that both vaccines were reconstituted with sterile diluent, lot #S008567, expiration date 23-SEP-2021.  It was reported that the patient should have received Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (Wistar RA 27-3) Virus Vaccine, Live(M-M-R II) instead of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (wrong product administered).  No adverse effects were reported.

his whole thigh was swollen; his whole thigh was hard; his whole thigh was hot; his whole  thigh was red; the office documented it was given subcutaneously but it was actually given intramuscularly; there was a little bit of hard knot; This spontaneous report has been received from the consumer, referring to her son, a 4 years old male patient. The patient did not have any medical history, current conditions, concomitant medications, drug reactions or allergies.  On 14-JUN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (rHA) (PROQUAD) one syringe, intramuscularly instead of subcutaneously on the top of his thigh, with lot number S000623 and expiration date on 06-JUL-2020, for prophylaxis (strength was not provided) (Incorrect route of product administration). It was also reported the sterile diluent for vaccine reconstitution, administered intramuscularly (strength, dose frequency, indication, lot number and expiration date were not reported).  In approximately June 2019, the patient initially had a little bit of a hard knot (Injection site nodule). Then, on 16-JUN-2019, when he woke up on the morning, his hole thigh was red (Erythema), hot (Feeling hot), swollen (Peripheral swelling), and hard (Induration). At beginning, his mother wondered if there was something wrong with this batch, but later she decided that her son's reaction was due to the inadvertently administration intramuscularly rather than subcutaneously. On an unknown date, the mother would take him to see the doctor. It was not reported if the patient received any treatment or if any laboratory or study were performed.  At the time of the report, the patient had not recovered from the events. The causality assessment between Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (rHA) (PROQUAD) and the aforementioned events was not reported.  This is one of several reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1906USA007443: US-009507513-1906USA007270: US-009507513-1906USA007149:

No adverse effects were reported; Multiple patients were administered improperly stored PROQUAD. Temperature -3 C; Information has been received from a medical assistant, concerning a patient of unknown age and gender. The patient's pertinent medical history, previous drug reactions/allergies, concurrent conditions and concomitant medication were not reported.      On 10-JUN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with improperly stored Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) (lot # R030805, expiration date: 22-APR-2020, albumin status: rha) (dose number, anatomical location, dose and route of administration were not provided) for prophylaxis, that was reconstituted with sterile diluent (DILUENT MRK) (strength, dose, lot #, expiration date and route of administration were not provided) (it was not reported if the sterile diluent (DILUENT MRK) used had an excursion).   The Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella (Oka-Merck) Virus Vaccine Live (PROQUAD) was stored at a temperature range of -9 degrees Celsius (°C) to 8°C (-3°C), for the time frame of 3 hours and 39 minutes. There was no previous temperature excursion and the call was because of a data logger. No adverse effects were reported. My son had a fever of 103. It was controlled with fever reducer. He had rash all over his body but more profound in the diaper area. He would not eat or drink for almost a week (only breast fed and had a few bites here and there, which is not like him at all ). The symptoms and fever lasted from 6/17/2019 to 6/23/2019.
LAB_DATA: On Monday June 17th , 2019 his regular doctor said it very well could be a reaction from his MMRV vaccine. She gave us cream for the rash and we went home. On Friday June 21st, 2019 I took him to after hours clinic because he was not eating or drinking all day. The doctor there said he had hand, foot, mouth disease. He did not have any sores on his hands, feet or mouth or inside the mouth.
CUR_ILL: swollen penis and redness near the circumcision area.

SYMPTOM_TEXT: My daughter had a low grade fever on july 2nd. She awoke that night (about 1 am) and had a seizure which lasted at least 3 minutes. We called 911 and she was taken to the emergency room. We were told that she had a febrile seizure, which had never happened before. I asked if it could be related to the vaccines she received a few days earlier and was told no, it was too long afterward (it had been about 4 days). She continued to run a fever above 100 degrees for the next 3 days. I took her to the pediatrician for a follow-up on July 4th since the fever had not broken. I asked again if it could be a vaccine reaction and again was told no. They screened her for a urinary tract infection (negative) and examined her for other signs of viral infection. None were found. They next day (7/5) she woke up with a red rash covering her entire torso. By evening it had spread to her face and bottom and became very itchy/uncomfortable for her. I took her in for a second follow up and stated that I was frustrated that this was pretty clearly a reaction to the vaccine (all of her symptoms from seizure to rash can be linked to the mmr vaccine per online sources). Again the doctor said it was possible but unlikely and that perhaps she had contracted rosacea (??!) At this time she has been fever free for about 36 hours and has had a rash for 48 hours. The rash now covers her entire body from head to toe and is itchy to the point that she is uncomfortable in clothes or a diaper and has difficulty sleeping.
CUR_ILL: stomach flu (possibly norovirus) one month prior, completely healthy at time of vaccine

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Fevers and shaking

Woke the during the night on 07/04/2019-07/05/2019 with nightmares and a fever of 105.  Mother tried to give him Tylenol but he vomited right after taking it.  Called the Dr office the next morning, 07/05/2019, and they could see him at 3 pm.  Mother then called us at 10:35 am.  Stated he still had a fever at that time of 103 and vomited and unable to keep any medicine down.  Encouraged her to take him to the ER for an evaluation.  Was given Zofran and then able to keep Tylenol down.  Mother states by 6pm that evening he was better and didn't have any more fevers or vomiting.

red raised bumps on her ankles, wrists and elbows; patient received a dose of VARIVAX and a dose of PROQUAD during the same office visit; localized redness at her right lateral thigh; This spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse and refers to a 1-year-old female patient. No details regarding the patient's pertinent medical history, concurrent conditions, concomitant medications and drug reactions or allergies were provided. On 19-JUN-2019, the patient received a dose of varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX) and measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (exact dose, strength, route and site of administration, lot # and expiration date were not reported for any), both as 1 year old vaccinations. Varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX) was reconstituted with sterile diluent (STERILE DILUENT MRK) (dose, lot # and expiration date were not reported). On an unknown date in June 2019, the patient developed localized redness at her right lateral thigh. On unspecified dates, the patient took an unspecified number of doses of diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL). On 21-JUN-2019, the patient developed red raised bumps on her ankles, wrists and elbows. The patient would be seeing a physician on an unspecified date. The outcome of the events was reported as not recovered/not resolved.  The causality assessment between the suspect products and the events was not provided.

negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers; negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers; negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers; negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers; negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers; the patient was vaccinated with PROQUAD on 6/20/2019; subsequently developed T cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia; Information has been received from a registered nurse referring to a currently 25 years old male patient. The patient's concurrent conditions included avascular necrosis of bilateral hips. Besides, the patient was allergic to oxycodone and had seasonal allergies. He did not have any concomitant medications. His historical conditions were not provided.  On an unknown date when he was a child, the patient was vaccinated with an unspecified number of doses of measles, mumps, and rubella (wistar ra 27-3) virus vaccine, live (M-M-R II); varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck )(VARIVAX); hepatitis a vaccine (manufacturer unknown) and hepatitis b vaccine (manufacturer unknown), all of them administered as prophylaxis (dose, route of administration, anatomical injection site, lot number and expiration date were unknown by reporter).  In May 2015, the patient developed T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia. On 20-JUN-2019, the patient was vaccinated with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) as prophylaxis (dose, dose number, anatomical injection site, lot number and expiration date were not provided; route of administration was unknown by reporter) (product administered to patient of inappropriate age). On an unknown date, the patient had negative measles, mumps, varicella, hepatitis A and hepatitis B titers (measles antibody negative, mumps antibody test negative, varicella virus test negative, hepatitis A antibody negative and hepatitis B antibody negative, respectively). No adverse symptoms were reported in regards to the patient receiving measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD). The patient sought for medical attention in a office visit, but it was unknown by reporter if he received any treatment for the event. It was reported that a blood work was performed, but the results were not provided.  At the time of the report, the patient had not recovered from the events. The causality assessment between all the suspect vaccines and T-cell type acute leukaemia, measles antibody negative, mumps antibody test negative, varicella virus test negative, hepatitis A antibody negative and hepatitis B antibody negative was not reported.  Upon internal review, t-cell type acute leukaemia was determined to be medically significant.
LAB_DATA: Test Name: Hepatitis A titers; Test Result: Negative  ; Test Name: Hepatitis B titers; Test Result: Negative  ; Test Name: Measles titers; Test Result: Negative  ; Test Name: Mumps titers; Test Result: Negative  ; Test Name: Varicella titers; Test Result: Negative
CUR_ILL: Avascular necrosis; Drug hypersensitivity; Seasonal allergy

the one unspecified 1 year old patient went to the physician office on 16-JUL-2019, and was diagnosed with "chicken pox"; This spontaneous report has been received from a nurse via a company representative, concerning a 1 year old male patient.      The patient's concurrent conditions, historical conditions, previous drug reactions, or allergies and concomitant medication were not reported.  On 11-JUL-2019, the patient was vaccinated with one dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (frequency, anatomical location, lot number and expiration date were not reported) as routine 12 month vaccination (prophylaxis).  Other suspect therapies included sterile diluent (MERCK STERILE DILUENT), which was used to reconstitute the vaccine (dose, frequency, route, lot number and expiration date were not reported).  On 16-JUL-2019, the patient went to the physicians office and he was diagnosed with chicken pox (varicella). The nurse stated that "it was unclear as the cause of the chicken pox as the child had been around other children and it may be that the child was exposed to the chicken pox from other children or possibly from receiving the measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) vaccine. Therefore, the patient received "standard treatment" for the event. At the reporting time, he was stable, however he had not recovered from the event. In addition, no other adverse effect was reported.   The causal relationship between varicella, measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) and other suspect therapy: sterile diluent (MERCK STERILE DILUENT), was not reported.
Adult patient was given MMRV vaccine. No adverse reaction noted.

Vaccine given 6/17/19.  Started methylphenidate on 6/29.   Developed diffuse urticaria to torso with some raised wheals to all extremities on 6/30.  Went to ED and given orapred 15 mg x 1 and famotidine 20 mg PO x 1.  Home with orapred 15 mg/15 ml - 5 ml BID x 2 days; 2.5 mg BID x 2 days and then 1.5 ml BID x 2 days.  On 7/2, rash worse with multiple scattered erythematous areas to body including left flank, upper chest and upper back.  Appear to be ruptured blebs.  Crusting noted to lips.  No oral mucosa involvement.  Given benadryl 12.5 mg IV x 1; famotidine 20 mg IV x 1 and solumedrol 40 mg IV x 1.  Given IV fluids.  Transferred to hospital.

Patient presented to clinic for a 1 year well child check along with her 4 year old sister. While getting shots ready for each child we placed the shots on separate trays. However when entering the room the trays were placed side by side and one nurse removed 2 shots from one tray so we were left with 2 trays with 2 shots on them. The second nurse then picked up the incorrect 2 shots for the 1 year old and administered them. The parents, nursing supervisor and provider were notified right away and the CDC was called. They stated patient would be fine may just be sore at the site and to keep an eye on her. Following incident reports and VARES filed.
LAB_DATA: There were no labs done following this
CUR_ILL: Patient was healthy at the time of the vaccinations and prior

SYMPTOM_TEXT: PROQUAD was given to a pregnant patient; This spontaneous prospective pregnancy report as received from a nurse referring to a currently 37 years old pregnant female patient. The patient had none pertinent medical history and none drug reactions or allergies. Concomitant medication included sterile diluent. The LMP and gestation were unknown except that she was early in the pregnancy based on lab hormone levels.  On unspecified date prior to 01-AUG-2019 vaccine titers were drawn and mumps were low; she was not immune to mumps. Office decided to give measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) because the patient's previous vaccination history was unknown. On 01-AUG-2019, the pregnant patient was vaccinated with measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (rHA) (PROQUAD) (0.5 ml once; lot number: R030801, expiration date: 22-APR-2020) subcutaneously, for prophylaxis. On that day, serum pregnancy test results initially looked negative so vaccine given then determined results actually were positive for pregnancy. Patient's present status was unknown. No treatment was given for the event. The pregnancy outcome was pending. The patient did not seek medical attention.

Minutes after administration of vaccination while I was documenting the encounter, I heard yelling in the hallway and someone yelling seizure. I rushed to the scene and was the first on site within five seconds. Patient was conscious  but, I sent my coworker to get the nearest doctor. I layed the patient down to help ensure her safety. Doctor arrived and helped treat patient. It was then determined through the patients mom that she actually passed out and was mistaken in her assumption of a seizure. Vitals were ran by Assistant and was determined by Doctor that it was a vasovagal reaction and syncope. Patient continued lying down for 20 minutes as we monitored her condition before they left.
LAB_DATA: The tests that were ran were vitals twice by Assistant due to the determination of it being Sycope.

Pt presented to clinic on 8/8/19 with mother. Pt reported itching of right deltoid same day of vaccination. Mother gave patient Benadryl at home as well as ibuprofen and ice pack for pain. Pt exhibits edema (Right upper arm : 18cm up from olecranon process is  34 cm on right and 31 cm on left). Mother was advised to continue Benadryl as needed as well as cool compresses. Advised to contact office if no improvement.

No adverse effects reported.; PROQUAD were administered/ that were improperly stored; This non-valid spontaneous report was received from a registered nurse and refers to unspecified number of patients of unknown demographics. There was no information about the patients' concurrent conditions or medical histories provided. The patients' concomitant therapies included sterile diluent. Since an unknown day in June 2019, the patients were vaccinated with improperly stored doses of varicella virus vaccine live (oka/merck)(VARIVAX)(exact doses, route of administration, lot# and expiration date were not reported) and measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (oka-merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (exact doses, route of administration, lot# and expiration date were not reported) for prophylaxis. The vaccines underwent temperature excursion of unknown temperature for unknown time frame. There were multiple previous temperature excursion since an unknown day in June 2019. The digital data logger was involved in recording excursion details. Diluent was reported to be stored properly. No adverse effects were reported.  Follow up information has been received from the nurse on 17-JUL-2019. On unknown dates, the patients were also vaccinated with improperly stored doses of Zoster Vaccine Live (ZOSTAVAX). The measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (Oka-Merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (lot # R004440, expiry date 12-AUG-2019) were exposed to temperature between 47 degrees Fahrenheit (F) to 77 F (between 9 degrees Celsius to 25 degrees Celsius) for 135 hours and was administered to unspecified patients on 17-APR-2019, 18-APR-2019, 22-APR-2019, 23-APR-2019, 24-APR-2019, 30-APR-2019, 07-MAY-2019, 15-MAY-2019, 21-JUN-2019, 24-JUN-2019 and 25- JUN-2019. The varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # S005080 and expiry date 19-FEB-2019) were exposed to temperature between 47 F to 77 F (between 9 degrees Celsius to 25 degrees Celsius) for 11 hours and 24 minutes. The varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # R018777 and expiry date 01-JUL-2020) were exposed to temperature between 47 F to 77 F (between 9 degrees Celsius to 25 degrees Celsius) for 135 hours. The measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (Oka-Merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (lot # R004440, expiry date 12-AUG-2019) were exposed to temperature between 6 F to 14 F (-14 C to -10 C) for 754 minutes and between 15 F to 46 F (-9 C to 8 C) for 41 minutes. The measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (Oka-Merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) (lot # S005074, expiry date 18-AUG-2020) were exposed to temperature between 6 F to 14 F (-14 C to -10 C) for 28 minutes and between 15 F to 46 F (-9 C to 8 C) for 32 minutes. The varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # R006753 and expiry date 06-MAR-2020) were exposed to temperature between 6 F to 14 F (-14 C to -10 C) for 754 minutes and between 15 F to 46 F (-9 C to 8 C) for 41 minutes. The varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # R027995 and expiry date 01-OCT-2020) were exposed to temperature between 6 F to 14 F (-14 C to -10 C) for 754 minutes and between 15 F to 46 F (-9 C to 8 C) for 41 minutes. The varicella virus vaccine live (Oka/Merck)(VARIVAX) (lot # S000582 and expiry date 19-FEB-2021) were exposed to temperature between 6 F to 14 F (-14 C to -10 C) for 28 minutes and between 15 F to 46 F (-9 C to 8 C) for 32 minutes.  On 12-AUG-2019, a telephone call was received from the registered nurse. She stated that she was in the process of completing forms with identifiable patients' information. Additional information has been requested.  Upon receipt of follow-up information it was determined that this case is now valid because the patient identifiers were received.  Follow up information from the nurse has been received on 12-AUG-2019, and refers to a 4-year-old male patient. On 30-APR-2019, the patient was vaccinated with improperly stored dose of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella (Oka-Merck) virus vaccine live (PROQUAD) subcutaneously.   This is one of multiple reports received from the same reporter.; Sender's Comments:  US-009507513-1907USA011162: US-009507513-1908USA004922: US-009507513-1908USA004969: US-009507513-1908USA004983 : US-009507513-1908USA004985 : US-009507513-1908USA005023 : US-009507513-1908USA005032 : US-009507513-1908USA005049 : US-009507513-1908USA005063 :

SYMPTOM_TEXT: Fever started on 8/12/2019, it went up to 104.4 the night of 8/13/2019.  The next morning, 8/14/2019, patient woke up with a mild rash on the back of her neck, chest-stomach area and back.  Rash is sparse in other areas.  Mild itchiness reported by patient.  No other symptoms reported.
HISTORY: Chronic cough stemming from pneumonia in November 2018

SYMPTOM_TEXT: on 8-13-19 started as red spot, then noticed redness and swelling to L upper arm, got bigger throughout day, redness spread but swelling seems improved - on exam L arm deltoid area w approximately 2"x2" erythematous sl firm and tender area, warm to touch, full rom, no streaking, sl raised - Dx:  Cellulitis of Left Upper extremity - Tx:  Amoxicillin-Pot Clavulanate 400-57mg take 2 chewable tabs Q12 hours for 10 days.

This was the first dose of Quadracel for the patient, but 4th doses of DTaP and IPV- patient previously received in Pentacel. SYMPTOM_TEXT: This is the first dose of Quadracel for the patient, but 4th doses of DTaP and IPV. On 7/11/19 pt received vaccinations - on 7/12/19 patient's mom called our office to report vaccination site of Quadracel on right thigh noted as red, inflamed and warm to touch. Pt fever 102.2, increased fatigue and decreased appetite. Swelling felt like fluid under the skin, not firm. Patient taken to urgent care, diagnosed with cellulitis and prescribed Cephalexin for 7 days. Pt seen again on 7/15/19 at urgent care for spreading of redness on skin near injection site; advised to continue antibiotics and monitor.
